Breakfast was everything 'packaged' with disposable plates & cultery, quite poor quality food, but for the inclusive price quite adequate. We were happy to stay here and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: ritz0529
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Inn this past summer while visiting a couple beaches in the LA area and I must say i was pretty impressed with this hotel. You do have a longer drive to local beaches like Santa Monica Beach, Venice Beach, etc but for the price you pay it's worth it. The rooms are clean, great staff and free breakfast (which isn't great but it's free). I definitely plan on staying at a La Quinta Inn in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: checo446
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire. The hotels interior feels a bit dated; however, the room was comfortable and clean but again felt a bit dated. My room did have a mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker which was nice. Self park in the garage is around $15 a night so you need to factor that into your stay. This is fairly typical of a lot of LA area hotels though. The fitness room on the second floor is adequate for cardio and has 2 treadmills, an elliptical and a stationary bike. Breakfast in the morning was adequate with a selection of eggs, potatoes, muffins, cereal, bread, toast, etc. The location is pretty good convenient to LAX and the 405 directly east. Overall, the hotel was suited for my needs for one night and I got a good night of sleep. I wouldn't be adverse to staying here the next time I come to LA for a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Still weighing pros and cons.”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights in late February and here are some of my observations. Although very close to the airport the shuttle times can be extremely long so please keep that in mind. The shuttle also picks up guests at the Westin and Holiday Inn before stopping here so If you have a large family with you on departure, a shortage of room on the shuttle could be an issue. If you rent a car and choose to leave it at the hotel parking garage the charge is $15.00 daily. One issue I had was a 3 day charge to my credit card for only 1 day of parking. I have traveled numerous times and should have gotten my receipt on checkout which is my fault. I just spoke to the front desk who told me they would credit my card so we will see. There are other cheaper lots by a couple of dollars. Room: The bed was so-so. Some people will love it, some won't. I don't care for rock hard beds and this one wasn't so I won't complain. They did not have an in room safe which would've been nice. The light over the sink wasn't very bright so I didn't shave. Too much light from the street came into the window at night and I did hear a bit too much noise from the outside but when you are at the airport, it comes with the territory. We stayed on the 10th floor. Breakfast: It was free. I did expect some type of breakfast meat though. We ate there the first morning and I checked the following 2 mornings but after seeing their selections, we opted for the McDonalds next door. They do offer cereal, yogurt with granola, eggs, potatoes, toast, muffins and on one day they had pancakes. Again, it is free. I didn't use the fitness facility so I can't comment on that. They also offer free internet. Overall the hotel wasn't bad and I would recommend it but next time I would look elsewhere for a few more of the amenities I'm looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: equinoxAK
Reviews.Content: If you are in LA for one night and just need a good place to sleep, this is the ticket. The shuttle is free, the bed is comfy, and there's food on the premises. If you want to take a bit of a walk, head out for about a mile down Century Blvd. and you can walk up to Trader Joe's, and next door is a all-you-can-eat buffet. The place was clean, the staff was friendly, and the shampoo fine. I don't need luxury, so this place was great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Samer16
Reviews.Content: Highlights: -Exceptional front desk staff -Efficient shuttles and nice drivers -FREE wireless internet -FREE breakfast -Great price Cons: -Slow elevator -No meat at breakfast For a romantic 6 day get-away to LA, I did a lot of checking on hotels and decided to stay at La Quinta LAX - what a great decision! The front staff were exceptionally nice and helpful, in person and on the phone. After reading reviews which commented on the traffic noise, I requested a room away from the road. The room which we received was in the back of the hotel and very, very quiet, perfect for a light sleeper like my boyfriend! It was also clean and had a nice decor. The bed was very comfortable and we slept soundly every night. The free shuttle service to LAX was convenient and the drivers courteous. The front staff also gave us great advice about where to go in Manhattan Beach and made it easy for us to purchase tickets for the Trolley to get there, which conveniently stops right outside the hotel. We did not rent a car, so we did not have to worry about parking. The maid service was unobtrusive and efficient. The only cons were the slow elevator, which isn't really a big deal, and having no meat at breakfast. There was a great variety of muffins, yogurt, cereal etc., but I prefer a heavy breakfast while I'm on vacation, so we just skipped the breakfast at the hotel and went to the Denny's down the street. Even though it doesn't seem to be in a great area, we still felt safe walking down Century Blvd., even very late at night. The bill was exactly correct at the end of the stay and check-out was a breeze. I feel like we received 4-star hotel treatment at a 2-star hotel price! Overall, it was an amazing and relaxing vacation and La Quinta helped make it so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value for overnight at LAX”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Nice La Quinta property. Room is typical, good quality. Had a minor problem with a closet door, and the maintenance man fixed it within 5 minutes after being called. Breakfast was above average. So convenient to LAX. Nothing much within walking distance in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice room, noisy street & air con”
Reviews.Author: 5dollar
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. The room was very nice and roomy. I especially liked the little sofa. It would be very good for familly with kids. The free breakfast was sufficient. The free Internet access was reliable. The air conditioning was very loud. We had to turn it off when we slept. We were here in the winter. It wasn't a big problem for us. In summer, it might be an issue. The parking was $15 a day with in and out privileges. We didn't have a problem in finding a parking space. The hotel is in Century Blvd., which is very busy and noisy. It is very close to the airport. They have free airport shuttle. You can watch the TV screen for the real time location of the shuttle. Overall, the value was good if you are not a sensitive sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable traveller's hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baselscot
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in La Quinta and found it to be a good choice with a comfortable, well equipped room. It's close to LAX with a free shuttle bus but I was never bothered by what aircraft noise there was. The beach was just a couple of short bus rides away and the weather was certainly warm enough to use it. Service and food in the hotel was of the high standard I expect in the USA. It is possible to get to downtown LA by public transport but it's a bit of a trek. But for early morning departures or short stay overs La Quinta has everything you'd need.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay while in LA!”
Reviews.Author: tarkus123
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA at least twice a year for business and found this gem in 2008 while in LA for a week long conference. All the hotels that the conference recommended in downtown LA were $200+. I decided to give this La Quinta a try to save some cash (free breakfast to boot). I was pleasantly surprised at the service and cleanliness of this hotel. It's a great location to the airport and the freeway. There's free WIFI in-room, the beds are very comfortable and considering it's proximity to the airport, it's very quiet. The adjacent parking garage is safe a convenient ($12 per day). The breakfast is always fresh and there is a decent variety of pastries, waffles or pancakes, juice, fruit, donuts, etc. The rooms also have a fridge and some have microwaves. I stayed for a week on that first visit in October of 2009. I returned in February of 2010 for 3 days, and again in October of 2010 for another week. It has been consistent. I should also note that I usually arrive later in the evening on my trips to LA (around 10pm or later) and the hotel restaurant closes at 10. However, there is a Denny's just about a block away that's very convenient and open 24 hours. Now for the cons....A minor thing - but something to mention: Elevators... They are VERY slow! The elevator in the parking garage on the first visit was almost useless. However, on the last visit it seemed to run a bit faster. The lobby elevators took so long on this last visit in Oct. 2010, that I rarely used them for the week I was there. Fortunately, I had a room on the second floor so I used the stairs most of the time. All in all - a great value for the money. Clean and comfortable. I'll be staying again in 2 weeks (Feb. 2011) and have made reservations for the Oct. 2011 conference I attend downtown. The money I save staying at this hotel rather than the downtown conference hotels allows me to rent a car and explore LA on off hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Family_of_four99
Reviews.Content: Visited for the LA Autoshow. Check in was quick, parking was easy and the rooms where good for the price. Don't expect luxury for the price. I think the rates are fair for what you get. Breakfast is always nice. Would stay again if I needed to be a close to the airport and all I needed was to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Perfect for a One-Night Stopover Between Flights”
Reviews.Author: helena-jo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta one night on our way to New York City from Australia and one night prior to our return to Australia. We found this hotel to be great value and in an ideal location for a one-night stay prior to flights. We were impressed with the variety of the free breakfasts, the fast speed of the free WiFi, the reliability of the free shuttle bus, the courtesy and efficiency of the staff, the cleanliness of the rooms which were not large but certainly adequate for a one-night stay, the close proximity to takeaway outlets - a petrol station with an array of food and other general commodities two doors down, Mc Donalds next door on one side and Taco Bell next door on the other and, of course, the excellent price for the room. We had a late departure on our return visit and it was no problem extending the stay for another half day in our room which cost less than $50 including taxes - perfect when facing a 15-hour flight! Another review commented on problems with the lifts but, for us, the three lifts were in working order throughout our stay. As this is an airport hotel, it is not in the best area but fine to venture out to the shops in close proximity. Although situated on a busy street, we found that, by being higher up, we did not experience any traffic noise from the cars`below nor was there any noise from planes. We would most definitely recommend this hotel for value for money, cleanliness, many free benefits and staff efficiency and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, fair priced place for pet owners”
Reviews.Author: marmot1995
Reviews.Content: This was my first LA trip with a dog in tow. I normally stay at the LAX Westin across the street because priceline often has great deals. But pets are $50 a night there. Right across the street is La Quinta LAX which has slightly cheaper parking, a great free breakfast (eggs, potatoes, toast, fruit, cereal, pastries), super clean rooms, and they don't charge for pets. Had a king room. No flat screen tv but that was fine with me. Thermostat worked very well. Super clean room and bathroom. Staff was brisk and not super friendly, but they were efficient and definitely made themselves available to answer questions. Could hear people coming and going in the hallways, but this seems pretty standard for hotels. Wifi was free and seemed to work well throughout the day and evening. I noticed numerous security guards in the lobby as well as on the floors. I never felt like I needed them around, but nonetheless it's always nice to have extra security around. This is an airport hotel so the area is ok but not great. It is on a major street but from my perspective this made it convenient....though not necessarily for walking. There is a taco bell and mcdonalds on either side of the hotel. This hotel exceeded my expectations given the fair price (for the area). I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable beds, free wifi, free airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: samamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta for one night before an early morning flight from LAX. The reception were helpful, advising us what time we should meet in reception to take the shuttle to the airport. Unfortunately the shuttle was running a fair bit late but we made it on time, which was fine. The room was spacious with two double beds. We were exhausted so spent most of our stay sleeping peacefully. They offer free breakfast but we weren't able to take advantage of it as we left at 5am and breakfast starts at 6!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Inexpensive Hotel For LAX Travel”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on the way back from Hawaii. The rate was $89 a night and was well worth it. Unlike most La Quintas, this is a high rise hotel. The room and bathroom were clean, the bed comfortable and there was a very long desk/work station to work at. TV was flat screen and had a good variety of channels and the free WI FI worked fine. There is a free airport shuttle shared by the Westin and Holiday Inn that runs every 15 minutes and I had no problems with it. The free breakfast buffet was a cut above the other free hotel breakfasts. There was a hot container of scrambled eggs and toast on a par with a nice Marriott style buffet along with the usual items. A previous reviewer complained she had to cross a 4 lane highway to go across the street to get water. She is referring to Century Blvd, a normal big city main street which is not a highway and which people cross routinely. For the rate charged along with free shuttle, free WI FI and free breakfast buffet, there cannot be a better place to stay if you staying for one night for an LAX flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: chr1711
Reviews.Content: Fairly straightforward budget hotel between the airport and the car rental places, seems most people only use it for an overnight - for which it is quite adequate. The bathroom was basic and the room was reasonable, the food was decent also - a shame the dishwasher seemed to have broken down next day as there were only disposable cups, plates and cutlery.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: marniemac
Reviews.Content: Qantas put us up here after the A380 grounding. Shame on them. What a dump. Rooms were clean but the beds were awful. As we didn't have our luggage I was forced to use the toiletries provided by the hotel - the shampoo was like paint stripper. There was no water in any of the vending machines (sold out) so was forced to cross the multi lane highway at 4am by myself in a really crappy area to get water. Not great as a lone female. I assume this place is cheap. It would want to be. Didn't eat in the restaurant as it was too depressing. Breakfast was served on styrofoam plates.... I think that says it all. Only pro was free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: catwoman00
Reviews.Content: The a/c went on as soon as I walked in - yay, since it was hot, but it smelled moldy and made me start to sneeze. Yuck. Bathroom door wouldn't close - warped. No hand towels were provided - I only had one washcloth and two bath towels - strange. Linens were clean, but the bed faced the a/c unit so everytime it went on, you get hit with a blast of air. The water was only lukewarm - I took a shower at 8 pm but didn't even have to mix any cold water in. Breakfast was pretty good though - scrambled eggs, toast, cold cereal, instant packages of oatmeal, decent coffee, and juice. Also, lots of sweet pastries that are easy to grab and go. Lobby of the hotel was clean, rooms and hallways upstairs were not. Shuttle bus to airport and to the hotel are frequent - every 15 minutes. Big Plus there. Free internet access in your room and a plus was the microwave and refrigerator in the room even though I didn't use it. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Long Term - Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: kea001
Reviews.Content: • Stayed for 9 days. • No complaints other than a noisy ice machine two doors down. • The hotel itself feels like a college dorm until you get inside your room which is more than adequate in size. If you think the bathroom is small here, you should see the ones in the Wilshire Grand downtown. For the price, I was really pleased with this place. • Quite adequate security. Didn't feel unsafe walking at night along W. Century towards LAX, although you will meet a handful of regular vagrants. • Public transit easily accessible although obviously trip distances to Beverly Hills and Hollywood are quite long. Manhattan Beach Trolley stops outside which is a bonus. • Although I didn't use it, good price for daily parking for LAX area. • Breakfast buffet quite good although you might want to skip the soggy toast. It can get quite crowded, particularly in the first hour or so with tour groups departing. Every seat in the lobby, restaurant and bar may be taken. You can grab a coffee and donut and wait it out. • For long term, you might consider getting a room with a microwave and fridge. • Staff very accommodating and professional. On my last day after check out they let me store my bags for free until I had to catch my late evening flight. • If you are looking for restaurant choices, go to Manhattan Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Fro_Yo_Pro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta for two nights and was very pleased with the value and convenience of this location. Within 1 mile of LAX and only 5 miles from Hawthorne (if you're a private pilot), this is a very convenient location to get to areas like Santa Monica, OC or downtown (crossroads of 405, 105, 10). Staff are friendly and helpful, great free breakfast buffet and even a pool. Parking is reasonable ($12 night) and there you can walk to car rental agencies (1-2 blocks), if you require one.

Reviews.Title: “very good ony complain small bath room”
Reviews.Author: indrawiguna76
Reviews.Content: very good hotel its not expensive . the place is pretty close to disneyland , we like the hotel , the breakfast is preetty good , definetly a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Great price close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Heinlager
Reviews.Content: For its price this hotel was great. Was 5 mins from LAX with free shuttle. Large room with king bed and large TV. Was a roof-top pool but I did not check this out. Also, decent breakfast but did not sample this too much. Location is not amazing, but plenty of fast food around as hotel does not have room service. Hotel is in between MacDonalds, Pizza Hutt and Taco Bell, but I went across the road for lunch one day to the restaurant at the Weston and this was very nice at a reasonable price. Not a huge amount to report apart from that this hotel certainly ticked all the right boxed and didn't disappoint. Clean, large rooms and nothing went missing - what else do you want for a 2-day layover! Only issue was the curtains did not close perfectly, but this just made me wake up on time and I unplugged the mini fridge as it was noisy...would not be great if you wanted to sleep in and keep stuff cold. Good tip was that if you are going too far in Los Angeles a town car is cheaper than a taxi. Went for 50mi business trip and XTC limousines was $95 each way incl tip rather than $125 + tip for a taxi. Much nicer in a big black sedan too...

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight stay between flights only”
Reviews.Author: Abbykat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after arriving from Australia, before travelling onto San Francisco the following morning. The accommodation was great, with a clean and comfortable room and everything you'd want for an overnight stay. It was very close to the airport with free shuttle transfers. Free internet was available in the lobby. A free but basic breakfast was available in the restaurant. We had arrived in late afternoon and wanted to look around. Our cheapest option was to take a trolley type tourist bus which stopped outside the hotel and which went to the beach or local shopping areas. Tickets available at the hotel for around $10 each return. We wouldn't recommend the hotel as a tourist destination as it was in the airport precinct with only the hotel restaurant and a couple of fast food outlets across the road. It wasn't even in a nice enough area to go for a walk, but was perfect for an in between flight stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - loud air con”
Reviews.Author: Relaxation_Finder
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel due to proximity to LAX after an 11 hour flight & wanted somewhere that was easy to navigate to. Basic - but good value compared to other airport hotels. Breakfast was from 6am which suited us as we woke early due to time difference & meant we could get on the road to Las Vegas quicker

Reviews.Title: “Decent airport hotel with a better than average pool”
Reviews.Author: montrealmom16
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but a bit cramped. We barely fit in a rollaway to accomodate one of the teens. We had an accessible room (not that we needed it) but I guess it's good to know they exist if you use a wheelchair. The bathroom shower was clearly newly renovated to accommodate wheelchairs. The pool on the fourth floor is great; bigger and deeper than your usual hotel pool. But beware: it's breezy up there and there are no towels available, so grab a couple from your room. We had fun watching the planes fly overhead. We had returned our rental car, so our dining options were limited. There's a MacDonald's right beside the hotel and if you dare dash across 6 lanes of traffic, there's a Subway across the street. But no table in the room to eat, so enjoy your dining experience out, We were not disturbed by the plane noise at night, partly because the air conditioner was so loud. And during the night, I heard a distinct scurrying sound in the wall above the bed. However, I'm told that it's common to have rats in roofs in California, and there was no other evidence of vermin. We were on the top floor. The 24-hour shuttle was indeed running early in the morning. We grabbed a quick coffee, muffin and piece of fruit from the free continental breakfast buffet and made it to the airport by 6:20.

Reviews.Title: “LOCK ALL YOUR STUFF...EVEN CLOTHES”
Reviews.Author: skell60
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a week. Given the price, the place and the breakfast is OK. However on the last day, found that a t-shirt of mine was missing. I agree that valuables should be locked, but cant one keep ordinary clothes outside ...??? I wish this hadnt happened because it was not a very good end to our trip. This experience would not make me trust the place again.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTrek
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the USA and I needed a place to stay near LAX before meeting my sister the next day. I did my research on TripAdvisor and decided on LaQuinta and I was not disappointed. The free shuttle bus was a lifesaver after a 12 hour flight - I was able to walk straight out of the terminal and onto the bus which dropped me off right outside LaQuinta's front door. Once there the check in staff were helpful and happy to answer questions. There were three or four fast food places right next door which were useful for a hungry traveller who just wanted to grab a bite and get to bed. The room was very clean and well equipped with more furniture and better quality fittings than I was expecting. The bed and linens were extremely comfortable and I got a great nights sleep - so good I slept in and missed the free breakfast they provide so unfortunately I can't comment on that. Oh and the free Internet was excellent. So really it ticked all the boxes and if I'm ever back in the US I'll be looking at LaQuinta inns first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tutu30
Reviews.Content: We stayed over for 2 nights due to a canceled flight. Hotel rates were fair and we loved that we were on a floor with a washer and dryer near our room. The food at the restaurant was very good. The overall service was excellent. We really enjoyed our stopover rest there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ashirley5
Reviews.Content: The LaQuinta was very nice and very clean. It had a couple of washer and dryers which was nice, a small convenience store next to it and the breakfast was good. The hotel did a great job with safety as well having security around the area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good La Quinta Airport hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: TheEffect
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the "best" La Quinta hotels nearby. Great location, clean rooms, good swimming pool, waited a bit longer for towels, but thats fine. Rooms are a bit small but good enough for a night. Would recommend and would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “only double beds”
Reviews.Author: wizofwoz
Reviews.Content: One of the things I always hate is hotels that charge over $100 a night, has the room to put queens in them but instead give you doubles only....and of course on their websites they say 2 beds. I had 3 teenage boys and me to share those 2 small beds so was not happy but we missed the allnighter out of LAX so were there for only about 5 hours. The free airport shuttle runs every 15 minutes 24 hours a day and it's only about a 10 minute ride, if that. The rooms however were very clean and spelled great upon entering. We left too early to sample the free breakfast beginning at 6 am. No coffee was offered in the lobby for several of us leaving at 5:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel convenient to LAX.”
Reviews.Author: Islandguy808
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here in June 2010 before a flight out of LAX. The room was very nice and the staff was helpful. The beds were very comfortable and the shuttle service to LAX was excellent. I plan to stay here again in August when I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, close to LAX, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bcfeyetr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights this past May. Went to check into our room, but housekeeping was still cleaning. No problems, after apologizing several times we were quickly set up in another room. Rooms were very nice, clean and quiet. (we were higher up but facing the street and had no issues with noise-but we were out most of the day) When I found out there was a fee for parking, I suprisingly/disappointedly said something to the effect of "oh [--] (as I thought it wass one of the several hundreds I had looked at on Tripadvisor that had free parking. She said "No problem, ma'am we'll comp your parking while you're here. NOT suggessting you do this as there is no guarauntee it will work, but just to show how great the staff was. A few minor complaints. I'm pretty sure there were 3 elevators but only one was working at the time and that one was SLOW. There are a few great fast food rest. with in walking distance (McDonald's,Subway, Pizza Hut/Taco Bell) but I just didn't get that "feel really safe" vibe after dark. (I'm from a smaller city of 700,000 in Canada) just my opinion Although the hot breakfast had a lot of variety, was filled regularly, tasted good--there was no meat. No sausages, bacon, ham...eggs are your only protein option really.

Reviews.Title: “still great!”
Reviews.Author: daniel_m84
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed here in 6 months, and it hasn't changed at all. Still awesome value for money and excellent proximity to LAX airport. We had 1 night to stay in LA before we flew out the next day. La Quinta has extremely clean and comfortable rooms. There is a gas station 2 doors up and a McDonalds next door for a quick meal. The breakfast they serve was incredible - cereals, fruit, hot food, bagels etc etc. Also used the gym they have inside, which was quite small, but adequate for a quick burn of some calories. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Yes its close the airport - but its an uncaring Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glitteryvix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice; 26th March and 9th April – on our first night and on our last night of our 2 week holiday of which we travelled around California, Arizona and Nevada. In general the hotel is nice, nice clean rooms with TV’s, close to the airport with a free shuttle to all terminals regularly through out the day/night, and a basic but ok breakfast. The hotel is well equipped - there is a restaurant/bar area, internet in reception and an outdoor pool with towels provided; which was to cold for us to use during our stay and it looked a little dirty to be honest anyway! Ok, now for the bad points! 1. During the night of our first stay my husband started to get chest pains and was struggling to breathe so I rang down to reception in a panic to ask for advice on getting a doctor, but no-one answered so I rang 911, who whilst I was on the line rang reception to let them know which room we were in and that the emergency services would be coming over, so I expected someone from the hotel to come and check we were ok, but they didn’t, nor did they after they had left, or the next morning when we checked out. I was really disappointed that the hotel doesn’t care about its guests and their wellbeing only about making money off them. 2. Hours after eating the eggs at breakfast I was very ill (can only really link getting ill to the eggs??)- vomiting etc, and couldn’t hold anything down for a day or 2 and I was very weak. We went to Palm Springs for one night after LA and spent the whole night / day in bed and never got to explore and was very upset about this. For all the hotel is in a good location for the airport and all the car rental places so is very handy I still would never stay here again or advise others to, I don’t feel this hotel really cares about its guests and being our first night so far away from home we felt very disappointed that the hotel manager or even reception staff never showed any compassion in what was an awful experience for us and what could have been a horrific situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay to catch a flight out of LAX!”
Reviews.Author: skighee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March on my way to St Thomas, USVI. The shuttle has you go to like 4 other hotels before getting here, but on the outbound it is the last stop! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was as promised, clean and comfortable. FREE wifi worked great. Breakfast was ok, some pancakes and the rest of the hotel fare. Good value if staying a night to catch a flight. BONUS - Taco Bell and McDonalds next door, got beer for my room at the gas station next door. Stopped at Subway and got a $5 footlong for my flight the next day and kept in my fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a pre/after flight stopover”
Reviews.Author: SurferDave08
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times since it became a La Quinta and can thoroughly recommend it for a pre or after flight stopover. It’s easy to find and a convenient location for car rental collection/drop off and access to the freeways. While not the most modern, no flat screens here, the rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet particularly if you get a room at the back away from Century Blvd. The prices are reasonable and include the standard buffet style breakfast. There is a restaurant but we didn’t try it. Be warned the hotel is popular with tour parties, they get up early so be prepared for a bit of a battle if you get to breakfast when they do. There is a free shuttle to/from the airport every 15 minutes 24hrs a day which calls at two other hotels. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a few nights if you need to be close to LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: destinymayhem
Reviews.Content: My partner and I caught the free shuttle to La Quinta and checked in pretty quickly once there. Our room was very spacious and clean. It wasn't over looking the main road so no noise problem at night when trying to sleep. It faced the Holiday Inn and looking out the window you can see the planes flying into LAX airport. We only stayed for 2 days/3 nights till we flew out to New York. Our first day we got a Taxi to Santa Monica. I think it was about $40 there and just a little bit more on the way back. good day trip. The next day we went to Manhattan Beach catching the Trolley that goes by right out font of the Hotel. We purchased tickets from the Hotel lobby. $10 for the 2 of us. The hotel is within 5 minutes walking distance to McDonals, Subway, Taco Bell and Pizza Hut. Also a servo on the corner. Internet cafe across the road. Also theres like a little cafe/gift shop next to the Hotel which sadly we discovered the last day. Would of saved some trips to the servo. They have a pool and a gym and free breakfast in the morning. Only issue with the hotel is the elevators are slow. You maybe standing there for 5 minutes or more waiting for it to come up/down the levels. Otherwise, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Airport Shuttle time schedule”
Reviews.Author: PARebob
Reviews.Content: Despite the cosmetic upgrades over the years, this hotel is still a 60's era dinosaur, albeit one with lipstick. For the price, it's a good enough place to stay if you have an early flight out of LAX. HOWEVER - Make sure that you don't rely on the "every 15 minutes, 24/7" line of bull they will tell you over and over at the front desk. Plan on taking the shuttle scheduled an hour before you really need to arrive at the airport. The shuttle serves three hotels (Westin, Holiday Inn, and La Quinta) and the LQ is the last one in line. Even if they were REALLY able to make the round trip in 15 minutes (possible if they didn't actually have to stop and pick up and drop off passengers), they can't, and if the shuttle happens to already be full when it gets to LQ, you'll be SOL.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but get a room away from the road”
Reviews.Author: jsnisu
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms here for 2 nights (when we arrived and when we left). I was traveling with my wife, sister and dad. The first night, my wife and I had a room not facing the road, but my sister and dad had a room facing the road. When we checked out the first time, my dad asked for a room away from the road because it was VERY noisy from the 3rd floor (my wife and I only heard a few planes, which is to be expected). They said only rooms with 1 bed were away from the road so he asked to be higher up. When we stayed there a few nights later, both rooms were facing the road. We were on the top floor (10th) and my dad/sister were on the 6th. Even from the 10th floor, it truly felt like we were on the first with how noisy it was. I expected a little airplane traffic, but didn't expect to hear all of the hoopla in the streets. Both nights, we didn't get to our rooms until 1:00 AM so even at that time, very loud. Parking was $12, which seemed a little much (until I paid $42 in San Francisco). The staff was nice. Breakfast was quite dull though (Hampton Inn's have a much better selection & 1000 times better coffee). There is a McDonalds about 150 feet away along with a gas station. So if you wanted snacks/food, you have access to it. I think there are a couple restaurants across the street as well, didn't check them out though. But, it all comes down to value. I think I only paid $70 for each room per night. For that price & location, I'd stay there again, but probably only on the days that I fly in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: JonnoCity
Reviews.Content: For less than $70, I was expecting a pretty dingy, small room. I was wrong. It was such a pleasant surprise to find a large, clean and airy room with a king bed. The bathroom was also excellent. Getting to the hotel from LAX was really easy- a shuttle bus comes by every 15 mins or so and drops passengers off at the door. Check in was quick; and the room was available even before the official check in time. Breakfast included pancakes, scrambled eggs, bagels, cereals, milk, yogurt, coffee etc- it was more than adequate. Overall, a real bargain and a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Nathan D
Reviews.Content: Close to LAX, good room and bar. breakfast was not the best but it did the job. Lots of car parking space and little shop for drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service for a nice property”
Reviews.Author: ShyamSS
Reviews.Content: I don't think people can expect customer service by phone, as no one seems bothered to pick up the phone at any point in time. The previous day i tried more than a dozen times, and had to change over go down to the reception to check for some stuff. It's pathetic and he promptly apologized. Well, mistakes do happen! But sadly when i called for some other stuff today evening, same issue, nobody cares a damn to pick up the phone in the front office and i think they can disconnect and not have one at all, rather paying rental for their property - hilarious, isn't it.. But, well the hotel is nice, close the airport, and breakfast just ok. The issue is - is that what you want, or you need better people, better approach to your issues / concerns..

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for price, but OK with some annoyances”
Reviews.Author: solaris_pete
Reviews.Content: The price and location is the best selling point of this hotel. There are some annoyances: Slow lobby elevator - ONE is always not in use SLOW and TINY parking lot elevator (stairs not an option). One of the tiniest elevators I have ever seen (if you have luggage, drop off at front entrance) parking lot was tight and spots are SMALL (luckily I had a small rental car, but I saw people with big trucks having trouble navigating around. In/Out of parking lot requires you "validate" your ticket Parking fee -- should be included Loud A/C some road noise from Century Blvd Boring Breakfast Local phone call charge Outdoor pool water is COLD! Very short hours for pool and fitness centre (9am-9pm)!!! Come on! Laundry is small Location is great - close to A/P and everything (car rental returns), restaurants, fastfood, gas station, convenience stores, malls, etc. Staff were quite accomodating and friendly. I would stay there again (mainly for the price and location). Free Wifi is a bonus

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the hotel and Staff- Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: summer135
Reviews.Content: This hotel was SO nice, the rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel staff was amazing, everyone was so friendly and willing to go out of their way to help out . The continental breakfast was fantastic, I was very impressed and will be back to this hotel and highly recommend it to others! I would not recommend the car rental place outside their hotel (Global All- state car rental) they were NOT friendly and tried to rip us off. Adding hidden fees and trying to charge us an extra day. Their cars were dirty and not safe to drive, our wheel was not sturdy. Even though they are cheap I would NEVER rent from them again

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this LA hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmplus
Reviews.Content: Considering LA prices, this hotel is truly a bargain. The location is not only close to the airport, but also centrally located to the LA area with easy freeway access. The rooms were clean, very spacious, and lots of storage. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast offerings were ample--although the flimsy utensils were annoying. The elevators were a little slow, and the parking situation could be improved to alleviate validation when going in and out, but these are little annoyances to me while traveling. If you stay here, you will have money in your pocket to spend on the other LA attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely impressed with La Quinta LAX!”
Reviews.Author: Foxpup82
Reviews.Content: I'm giving top marks to this hotel! I travel through LAX once a year from Australia, and I usually stay at the Super 8 LAX, which is also excellent value, but wanted a change of pace. So for avout $10 more, I thought I'd try out La Quinta. Check-in was very quick, and even though I arrived a little early before the check-in time, they were very understanding about my long overseas flight and got me into a room right away. This meant a lot to me, as I was dead on my feet. The room was absolutely spotless - being a former housekeeper, I am a harsh judge. But this place passed with flying colours. The decor was modern and very appealing - the sheets on the bed were new and crisp, and felt like 100% cotton. The bed was very comfortable, and the heater was easy to figure out, and the room was toasty in no time. The bathroom was totally modern, and again, super clean, with nice fluffy towels, hair dryer, etc. Hot water was no problem, and the water pressure in the shower was great. The room was also more spacious than I thought it would be. The view was rather average, but that was not a huge factor for me - the quiet of the room was more important, and it was nice and quiet during the day and during the night. The area is also pretty average, but then again, we're talking the LAX airport neighborhood - not a lot going on except for hotels and gas stations, it's not where the "action" is! The staff was great - very nice, and very professional. The free breakfast was pretty basic, but just fine for a light appetite - juice, bagels, muffins, that sort of thing. The dining area also had a nice decor. I had brought my laptop, and the WiFi service worked easily, no problems hooking up to the internet at all. The only criticism I have is the airport shuttle - be forewarned that unlike the Super 8 shuttle, it stops off at three other hotels, so I found it to be not as quick. I was worried that I would miss my flight, as I misjudged the time it would take the shuttle to get to the airport (hadn't expected all the stops!). And I did end up missing my flight, actually!!! So plan ahead, and take an earlier shuttle than you think you'll need. Not a big deal, just be aware of the time, and take a little more than you think you need. All in all, one of the best hotels I've stayed at - I can highly recommend it, and will be staying there on next year's trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms; service can be improved”
Reviews.Author: Ningu1
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel offer excellent value at the price and is well appointed. There is also free wifi which is great. The free breakfast was a sad affair with a poor selection, with plastic cutlery and disposable plates. Not worth it. We were stuck in the lift on the way to our room, and although the problem was resolved within 20 minutes, an apology or a call to check if we were OK would have been nice from management, I would recommend this hotel based on its excellent room offering alone. Overall service should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: pesr0412
Reviews.Content: I like La Quinta Hotels, I receive good treatment, no complains and the service is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Yukon578
Reviews.Content: I had hoped to find a location that was not so close to LAX. The room was much smaller compared to the same accomodations at other La Quinta Hotels where we have stayed. The breakfast was below expectations given the size and location of the hotel. The check-in process was very smooth and professional. Unless a friend is traveling with a pet and/or needs to stay close to LAX, I would not recommend this hotel. The room was a bit pricey given the fact that we have had better accomodations at other La Quinta Inn's for a lower price. I had to pay for parking. This was a first for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot comparable to higher priced marquee hotels.”
Reviews.Author: RickyH1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (Jan.16-18) before heading out to Ventura. I had price checked most of the LAX area hotels and decided to stay here based on the decent rate and the other Tripadvisor reviews. Their shuttle from the hotel was fast and efficient, and we used it to go back to the airport the next day to catch the rental car shuttles - no hassles. The desk staff were excellent (especially Edvin) who gave us an upgraded King room with Fridge, etc. The room was clean and quiet (opposite side to Century Blvd). We heard some noise one night in the hallway as the room had at least a 1 inch gap at the bottom of the door. Their were a couple of fast food places nearby (Subway, Carls, McDonalds), but not much in the way of nice "sitdown" establishments without having to take a bit of a drive. All in all I would recommend this hotel as it was clean, safe, friendly and a terrific value compared to others in the area. Oh - and they had a great complimentary breakfast with waffles, pancakes, scrambled eggs, etc. Great Bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: T0URI5T
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days in Dec 2009, I chose this hotel because of the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, and they were right. The rooms are just fine. The lobby is nice, the staff are friendly and helpful. There is a $12 per day charge for parking in their parkade. Also you have to go to the front desk and have your parking validated every time you leave the hotel, which is a real pain if there's a line up. Be sure to try the buffet at 'The Proud Bird' - a warbird-themed restaraunt clos by on Aviation Blvd. very impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Slotmachinequeen
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay after cruise and before an early morning flight. Shuttle was convenient. Check in at 2PM, front desk clerks were very efficient and used your name, which is nice. Room was clean and comfortable, but a little dated. If you are on the street side the traffic noise can be heard, but I just put the ac fan on and slept well. Several fast food places within a block. Left before breakfast. Needed to print a boarding pass, the lobby computer was out of order but the desk clerk cheerfully volunteered the front desk one and I printed off my pass. Would stay again if I was overnight at LAX. Price was very reasonable. One odd thing was that the soda machine doesn't take cash, only debit or credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and inexpensive, but traffic noise needs getting use to”
Reviews.Author: CannukGuy
Reviews.Content: Great value, rooms are clean and well kept. Hot breakfast consisting of scrambled eggs and pancakes hit the spot. The downside is the traffic noise from Century BLVD. Our room was on the 7th floor on the street side of the building. I was awaken by 5:30 am from sirens and general buzz of the traffic. I didn't think to ask for a room on the opposite side. We had to return a rental car at the airport, and It was not quite walking distance - especially at night. So we had to take a shuttle from the rental to the airport, and then take the hotel shuttle back to the hotel. There are hotels closer to the airport car rentals that we'll consider if we have to do that again. Access to a printer to print my boarding pass would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Purpleraine
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego and came out to Los Angeles for business meetings a few days last week and this week. What a pleasant surprise - the place is very clean, staff were very courteous/accomodating; parking is adequate, location is great - next door to Mc Donalds for hot chocolates; breakfast is good to have; rooms are spacious and smelled fresh. We requested for a room away from the main street - with no extra charge to upgrade to a king size bed, we were assigned a room to the back with beautiful views and really quiet. Newspaper was delivered to the rooms. Room furniture is trendy/comfortable - Great value for the price/location/cleanliness. We booked a room the second time.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location to LAX”
Reviews.Author: lazza999
Reviews.Content: I booked this after reviews on this site and was not disapointed. The shuttle was quick and easy, the check in was fast even though it was 11pm on a Friday and 10 people got off at the hotel. The room was clean, roomy and comfortable and the free internet was really handy!! I was only here one night and didn't get up early enough for the breakfast, but with a 12pm checkout it allowed me to catch up on some sleep. There are also washing machines on one of the floors which was a godsend half way through a trip. Washing power and change can be gotten from the little shop in the lobby. There is a Mcdonalds next door which is handy for the late arrivers, and they allowed me to leave my bags with them while I went and got the hire car so I didn't have to lug my bags around the place. I'd stay here again if I need a airport hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mahadragon
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at La Quinta. Parking was $12 per day, added to $86/night made it quite reasonable. La Quinta has a boutiquish feel to it, with small rooms and nice (fancy) light fixtures, shower curtains, etc. Breakfast was adequate: scrambled eggs (quite good), pancakes with syrup, yogurt (strawberry?), cereal with milk, orange juice, iced tea (or maybe it was regular tea?), bagel w/cream cheese, bread with butter or jam, mini muffins like blueberry (teeny tiny muffins approx 2" wide), there was a toaster machine to do all the toasting which lots of people wound up getting in line for, and fruit like small apples. Breakfast served from 6a to 9a. Do get there in time because this area gets crowded in the morning. Front desk is nice, the security guy is nice person too. I didn't know about the hotel shuttle service because I rented a car. There is a pool on the 4th floor that is kind of hard to find. It's all the way down on the end of the hall and you have to look for it and take some stairs down to an outdoor area. From what I could tell the pool was heated, but it wasn't 80 degrees or anything, maybe 68? It wasn't freezing cold. I enjoyed using the workout facility on the 2nd floor. Didn't use the treadmills, but did do my jump rope routine happily in front of the mirrors. The workout room is small, only 3 or 4 treadmills/bicycle machine type things (I didn't even bother to look because I don't use those things). There is a tv with remote inside with a water dispenser. The water dispenser was useful because I only needed to buy 1 bottle of water and refill it each day (learned this trick in Thailand). There was an ice machine on my floor (8th). I like the 12pm check out time, anything earlier is usually too early for me. Staff is all hispanic. There is a funny gift shop across the way, selling Mickey Mouse items, candy bars, and other misc stuffs. I don't like the way they do parking. You drive into the parking garage, grab a ticket, and then you have to take that ticket to the front desk so they can put it through the machine so you can leave the facility without paying twice. If someone is already at the desk, or there is a long line, you may wind up waiting a while just to get your parking ticket validated (potentially inconvenient). There is a McDonald's in the area and Subway. I didn't see any other fast food nearby. There is also AM/PM store next to the McDonald's that had the Listerine I needed to buy. This location is very close to "rental car row" which has all the rental cars people rent from the airport (Hertz, Budget, Avis, etc.). Would definitely consider staying here again when I come back into town in a few days. Oh, you are very close to the airport. I'm surprised airplane noise was not a bigger issue because those planes pretty much fly right over you. I could hear the airplanes flying overhead, but it was not really a big deal at all. Maybe if I were on the 10th floor it would be a big deal, but I was on the 8th. It was very quiet, sound proofing is very good, although if rude people were talking in the hallways I could hear it. The bed was great, not too soft, not too hard. 6 pillows total. Sheets were thin, I didn't like that part. The heater was quite loud, wound up turning it off completely. Temp control wasn't a big issue, Los Angeles in December, is not really hot or cold. My desk wasn't equipped with a free pen, not sure why. I had the King bed so it came with microwave and fridge. The fridge was useful to keep my fruits and water cold. Coffee maker located in the bathroom with coffee packets ready to use. This hotel is located approx 3 miles from decent shopping area. Just head straight west on Century (towards McDonald's) for about 3 miles and you'll run into Target, Ross, Marshalls, and a bevy of restaurants and stores. Free internet only worked for me in the lobby. I couldn't get it to work on the 8th floor. There are $5.99 lunch specials. Dinner is a little more pricey but they give you 20% off your restaurant meal when you check in. The food at the restaurant is surprisingly good, do not hesitate to eat there. I ate there for breafast lunch and dinner, and I'll be honest, I am not the kind of person that enjoys eating inside the hotel because 1) generally hotel food is not very good and 2) I like to broaden my horizons and see what's out there.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tulipjones
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a layover. Rooms are clean and comfortable. I really appreciated the free Internet and large desk. Ample sockets to recharge all of your electronic devices. They have items such as toothbrushes, razors, etc., for free at the front desk. I never had to wait long for the shuttle to pick me up. The only let down was the breakfast. A little bit too bread and cereal heavy. There are numerous fast food options surrounding the hotel, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the skeptical”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Red86
Reviews.Content: Lately I have been very careful of where I stay since hotels have become very complacent with their guests. Cutting corners and not caring about customer service. But this hotel was #1, very clean for the price which was VERY VERY reasonable for Los Angeles. I would definitely stay there again until they start to disappoint me like others.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and moderately priced”
Reviews.Author: globeseeker007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a long flight from overseas before continuing on to our destination in the U.S.. It's close to the airport and the staff is very friendly and helpful. You can't beat the price of $72 plus change, including tax, for a clean and comfortable room with a kingsize bed. The place has a great continental breakfast consisting of bagles & cream cheese, granola & milk, yoghurt, juice, tea, and coffee. It has a restaurant which is open for dinner. There is another convenient restaurant, LAX Cafe', across the street. This place also has computers with internet access and is very moderate in its prices. The shuttle from La Quinta to Terminal 1 at LAX only takes 7 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “You're buying value and location - and get it.”
Reviews.Author: LennysBrother
Reviews.Content: Low price, close to the airport. That's what we wanted; that's what we got. This hotel was reasonably clean and well maintained. The room was fine, with coffee maker, microwave and fridge. The TV was a little small by today's standards but not problematic. The included breakfast was pretty standard (i.e., what you get when there is no kitchen on site). Service was polite and efficient. Like others, they have an airport shuttle. The parking is $10 per night (plus a 10% parking tax!!).

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay!!!!! Well done La Quinta top marks”
Reviews.Author: chessybear
Reviews.Content: Am writing this review as we are waiting to leave for our next flight in the hotel room (free hifi wifi). Arrived very early from a flight from Australia 8.30am the receptionist Elisabeth was extremely pleasant and helpful and to our surprise she gave us a room immediately (we even got offered breakfast). The foyer, breakfast room and our room were all of a good quality (yes its not the hilton, marriott) but then we are not paying 5star prices either., The rooms were nicely furnished no signs of wear in our room at least, beds and pillows are extremely comfortable and the free wifi was a bonus. Bathroom is a little small but that didn't bother us. It is alittle noisey but you are at the airport and beside a busy higway, if you don't like noise go stay somewhere else. Breakfast, was standard continental, again free so why would you complain. There is a pizza hut, macdonals, subway, and a gas station plus a holiday inn so plenty of eating options. We also liked the $3.00 return manhatten beach trolley its a pleasant ride along the beach front and there are 3 stops with numerous shops and eating options, at each and sightseeing to pass sometime away whilst waiting for your next flight. All in all I would definitely stay here again. Felt safe walking to the eateries near by.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: daniel_m84
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 night stopover at LAX before our flight back home, and booked in at La Quinta Inn due to the great rate we received. We were very impressed by this hotel, and will definitely stay here again! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is in an excellent location, only a few minutes drive from LAX airport. There are numerous fast food outlets next door for a quick bite to eat, and the hotel itself does an excellent breakfast for guests. The shuttle to the airport runs every 15 minutes and was extremely reliable both ways we caught it. Room wise, the room has a nice LCD TV, big comfortable beds, excellent free wifi and the rooms are relatively quiet. Definitely recommend this place to anyone stopping over at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy for the buck”
Reviews.Author: ganderson13
Reviews.Content: We were in Los Angeles for Parent Weekend at USC. I spent hours looking for hotels. Most of the big names Marriott, Wyndum etc, had terrible reviews such as bed bugs, other sorts of creepy crawlies, unclean rooms and higher parking fees. This hotel was the only one I found that didn't have any negative comments. Rightfyfully so. It was convenient to the airport, and actually not that bad to USC. We had a great room, it was very clean and ALL of the staff were very friendly and helpful, including directions. The contental breakfast was good and plentiful. After reading reviews of all those other hotels, I can't speak highly enough of this hotel. We have found a home for the next four (hopefully only four) years. You can't go wrong here. Cheapest parking around also. If you have never been to LA, be prepared to pay for parking everywhere. It is a rip-off, but such is life.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: travelcatzUK
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel following recommendations on Tripadvisor. There were six of us (aged 25-29) flying out from the UK and the next day we were heading to Las Vegas. We wanted something close to the airport and relatively cheap (we ended up paying £35 pn! A real bargain! ). This hotel offers free shuttles from the airport (be warned it does take about 20 minutes to get out of the terminals if you are in 1 or 2!). The rooms were large and we had two king beds, plus another chair. The room also had free wifi which was great! There were a little dated, but then for the price we paid, we weren't expecting luxury. Another great thing was that this hotel had a free continental breakfast. From 6 til 9 a.m. breads, cereals, pancakes, yoghurts etc were all served. We filled up before our drive to Vegas! If you want fast food, then there is a MacDonald’s and a Subway just outside the hotel. I would definitely recommend this if you arrive on a late flight. It's somewhere to rest a weary head and it won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deejaydee1
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days in one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in, hotel-wise. Helpful, friendly front desk staff, nice breakfast spread, convenient bar area. Comfy queen bed and linens, spotlessly clean bathroom, and four-bars (free) Wi-Fi. Shuttle to/from LAX was timely and reliable. Will stay here again whenever I'm in the L.A. area!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with choice.”
Reviews.Author: Aus_Nomads
Reviews.Content: We arrived at La Quinta LAX from Australia for two nights, before travelling across the USA. The shuttle bus to and from the airport was reliable and convenient. Some airport-looking "official", directed us to the shuttle pickup area and then ask for a donation to some charity. The mini-bus had an electronic sign listing the several hotels it services. Our room wasn’t ready due to a slight early arrival, so La Quinta upgraded us to one with Microwave and Fridge, which came in handy. The room was quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was fine and kept us going. We also did the Manhattan Beach tour, with the pickup point just outside the hotel, which helped soaked up a half day, as we battled to get the jetlag under control.

Reviews.Title: “lifesavers!”
Reviews.Author: Lily7
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled to go home to Australia after a two week visit to the US. We were told we wouldn't get another flight for two days. The airline directed us to La Quinta on a distressed passenger ticket. We arrived at around 1am, tired and upset at not going home! The place was busy, they had a function in another room but we were greeted with friendly staff who went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and offer assistance. We used the internet to try get another flight home and were helped immensly! The room was fantastic, as was the overall service. The two days there turned out to be a relaxing end to our trip, thanks to the La Quinta staff! We were given travel advice and help, as well as help with our tickets when we finally were able to get home. So accomodating and willing to assist in any way! The hotel is near LAX, with a free shuttle ever 15 minutes that we made use of. We visited Manhattan Beach after a staff member helped us with cheap tickets on a round trip shuttle and we had a blast. Definitely the place to stay if you need to be near LAX. After a distressing end to the trip the La Quinta staff made us feel calm and welcome! Thank you La Quinta!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay near airport if you have early/late flight”
Reviews.Author: nyc4444
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at La Quinta LAX. I take one trip to LA from the east coast each year and always take a late flight that gets me in after 10pm PT, so I always spend my first night in LA at an airport hotel before moving on to my final destination in California. This hotel is close to the airport, very clean and comfortable and provides a free continental breakfast so that you can grab something on your way out in the morning. I usually take the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel and then I get my rental car in the morning. Depending on what car rental company I'm using, I either take the shuttle back to the airport in the morning and then get the appropriate car rental shuttle, or if I'm renting from Fox. It's within walking distance of the hotel, so that is really convenient as well. There is 24 hour McDonalds right next to the hote for late night snacks. The area the hotel is in is not all that great, but neither are ANY of the airport hotels I've stayed in near LAX. I would highly recommend this hotel for a 1-nighter. It's under $100, it's conveniently located and it's clean. Waiting for the shuttle at the airport can sometimes take 15 minutes or so which is a drag when it's late and you've been flying all day, but other than that, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay Except for Breakfast Menu”
Reviews.Author: AFirstTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was spotless clean and staff was accommodating. The bed was comfy enough and the room is spacious. Although it's only a mile away from the airport, I did not hear any airplanes passing. It's also within 30minutes from Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm and 20 minutes away from Downtown LA. There are two things I didn't like about the hotel. I had to pay for $12/night for the parking. Imagine, I stayed there for 7 nights. Another is their breakfast. I can only take 2 days of their food... Good thing La Quinta is right beside several food chains. In fact, it is right across Mc Donald's.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stopover - great price”
Reviews.Author: suze65
Reviews.Content: We just used this hotel for a one night stopover. Excellent value for money. Clean,spacious room and great complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well appointed. clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: ovalball
Reviews.Content: Conveniently situated about 1 mile away from the car rentals there are also a Tacobel/McDonalds and Subway within a stones throw if you need a snac. We had a good night's rest after our long haul flight into LA. The staff were helpful and cheerful. The room was roomy with King bed and small settee and all the facilities you need. All in very good condition and very clean throughout. We can't vouch for the breakfast because we were on the road by 4.15am - but previous La Quintas we've stayed in have supplied a decent one. We booked on the La Quinta site and used one of their promotion codes (just Google for it !!) to get a 20% reduction - so it was good value for money. Car Parking is secure but does cost just over $10 per night. - pretty much par for the area. All in all, a pleasant experience at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel for a Short Stopover”
Reviews.Author: ltrott
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect hotel for our short stopover on our away to Australia. There was a great free continental buffet. Room was recently renovated to a modern standard. What was interesting is that pets could stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loyal to La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: OhLoveNYC
Reviews.Content: Recent mom & daughter trip. Picked this LaQuinta for it's price, close proximity to LAX & car rentals, only 8 miles from Venice Beach, free breakfast buffet, loyalty points, friendly staff and comfy beds. Safe parking $12/night. W Century Blvd traffic a little loud, but bearable. I asked for room on other side of bldg but was told they only had 1 bed in those rooms. McDonalds right next door which we did not frequent even tho I would have felt safe since it was so close. However, there are homeless people around & I would not feel comfortable going any further on foot. Would definitely stay there again! Be careful on the freeways! They drive like maniacs!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: The La Qunta at LAX worked well for me on a recent trip when I needed to stay near the airport for an early morning flight. The shuttle from the airport to the hotel arrived soon after I got in line. It goes to 2 other hotels first but still didn't take too long. My room was tastefully furnished and was comfortable. There are not a huge number of dining choices within walking distance of the hotel. There is a place in the hotel with a limited menu and a McDonalds next door and a Subway across the street. I had to leave earlier than when breakfast is served so I can't comment on that. I had to wait about 15-20 minutes for the shuttle to the airport but that's the amount of time they tell you to allot so no complaints there. The little contact I had with the front desk staff was a pleasant experience. If I get another good rate at the La Quinta I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennyf2
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again in a sec! We just got back from a wkd trip to LAX -- I had 2 teenagers & my 8 yr old son with me. The staff was great, beds were great, breakfast was good! Parking was $12.00 comparable to most (probably a little less). The pool is small but we were out & about most of the time!

Reviews.Title: “What was needed”
Reviews.Author: Little_Lebowski
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LA in the evening and just wanted somewhere to collapse for the night before heading into the city. This place did the job beautifully, the room was clean, spacious and very comfortable, just what you want after a long fight. Staff were friendly, and breakfast was pretty decent. Our room was roadside, and we were able to hear the traffic going by, but it wasn't enough to keep us awake or disturb us. We were high up so I guess this could be more of a problem if you're on a lower floor. We did have to wait about 50 minutes for the shuttle to arrive, which was the most irritating part of our stay. Other than that, there's very little to complain about. If you need a place near the airport to crash, I very much doubt you can do better than this for the money.

Reviews.Title: “really great value if you can get the cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: theproo
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal for booking early and paid only half the regular price. Parking was extra but given the price we paid for the room and that the carpark was secure, I was more than happy to pay. The hotel itself is a 3-3.5 star. Beds were comfy and there was free wifi - a big bonus. Breakfast was free although it's pretty basic (toast, bagels, cereal, etc.). A real gem if you get the discount rate but I would reconsider if I had to pay the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “When all is said and done, no reason to complain”
Reviews.Author: hazelhazel
Reviews.Content: We needed an affordable hotel near the airport for two nights. Rooftop pool kind of nice. They charge $10 per day for parking. Breakfasts are nothing to write home about. But the staff was very very helpful. Printing out boarding passes, mapped out where we needed to go. Overall they were very friendly. Nothing to write home about, but for $79 a night for a family of four, who's to complain?

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: toothclner
Reviews.Content: If you need a place to stay for one or two nights near LAX, you can't beat this hotel for the price. We had an early flight out of LAX, so chose this hotel based on proximity, the awesome AAA rate, and glowing reviews already given on tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed. The gal at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly at check-in. The rooms were nice and clean, but on the small side with two double beds and a small bathroom, but fine for a family of 4. We had relatives staying in the room next to ours, so we were able to get two rooms with connecting doors which was handy. The outdoor pool was adequate....on the 4th floor. The kids said it was warm. Unfortunately there wasn't a hot tub though. We stayed on the 6th floor, Century Blvd. side, and had no trouble with car or jet noise. The beds were really comfortable, the laundry area nice - right down the hall from our room. The only downfall about this hotel would be the parking. You have to park in the garage even for check-in, but the first 20 min. are free. Warning - don't stay any longer than that or they'll charge you and you can't get out of the garage gate until you go back into the lobby and pay. There is a button on the ticket machine that connects you to the front desk, which we had to use twice because of mix-ups with our tickets. They let us through both times, but it was frustrating because we had a line up of cars behind us trying to get out of this tiny parking garage. More of a hassle than anything, but the only option for parking your car. Since we were extremely tired from spending all week at Disneyland, we called in a dinner order to the hotel restaurant. They were out of a few items that we wanted, but the food was pretty good, although a little on the expensive side. There is an In- and-Out Burgers on Sepulveda just about 5 min. away though, which we ate lunch at. If we weren't so tired we probably would have gone back there for dinner.....it was so delicious!!!!! We also were able to drive to Santa Monica Pier after we checked-in an hour early. It only took about 30 min. each way and was easy to get to. There are other beaches that are closer to the hotel though. We had to be at LAX by 5:15 a.m. and had no trouble dropping our Alamo rental car off and then catching the shuttle to the airport. It took us a total of about 20 min. to do all of that. Hi-speed internet also worked great! I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to stay before you catch a flight. It's clean, contemporary, friendly, and inexpensive, but doesn't feel "cheap." I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an overnight near LAX”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler51
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the La Quinta because we wanted to be close to the airport for an early morning departure. It is a very basic hotel within less than a mile of LAX. It is a little worn looking, but we thought it was a good value (by L.A. standards) at a base rate under $100 a night. We were able to do an early check-in on arrival. Our king room was not large but was clean and comfortable and included a mini-fridge, a small microwave, and a coffee maker. The bed was fine -- nothing special but I slept well. There was a standard color TV that appeared to have in-room movie and video game options as well as an array of TV stations and HBO. The desk area included a lamp with two electrical outlets that made it convenient for use of a laptop. Wifi internet was free. The bathroom was small but clean and perfectly adequate, except that toiletries have to be requested at the front desk. The airport shuttle ran on time and it took less than 10 minutes to get to the terminal from the hotel. The main negative of this hotel is the thin walls. We were able to hear quite a bit of noise from adjoining rooms and the hallway, but luckily there was not a lot of activity. Also, the hotel is in a neighborhood that is not really suited for a long stay. The neighborhood actually seemed a little rough -- probably not the kind of area you want to be walking around in after dark. It is definitely a one or two night spot for people traveling in and out by air. Still, we were glad we picked this spot for our overnight instead of the much more expensive hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “no hope of free early check in”
Reviews.Author: truenorth27
Reviews.Content: On arrival to Los Angeles after spending 17 hours in the air and more at 3 airports, I was quite disappointed that even though they had a room ready and available they wouldn't let us check in before 11am unless we paid around $50. It is convenient to the airport for those without a vehicle due to the free shuttle bus (but as the driver said, free but just tips). They have a free breakfast - disposable cutlery, plates and cups. Their pancakes have a weird taste but other than that it is ok. Upon check out they would not take my travel card which is a Visa because it did not have my name on it. This was the only place in our whole trip that refused to take this form of payment. The room itself was nice, but the bathroom really needs some kind of exhaust fan. They offer guests free internet in the lobby which is one computer (no chair) that has a monitor at an immovable peculiar angle which makes it uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but clean”
Reviews.Author: Wilson60
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here overnight after missing my flight home. The hotel was fairly expensive and in a noisy area. Otherwise, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: jhassworld
Reviews.Content: i had nice stay my kids liked it but swimming pool was not in use the time i stayed

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose well”
Reviews.Author: DeaconFans
Reviews.Content: We needed a room close to LAX airport as we had an early flight the next morning. It served the purpose exactly. Very close to the airport. Good value. Comfortable and clean room. Desk staff very nice and courteous...they printed out our boarding passes. Parking on site was helpful. Breakfast bar in the morning was adequate but not great. We had 4 in our room but only 3 sets of towels but that was the only problem. Not the quietest room as we overlooked a major road, but it didn't keep us up at night.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are better than the hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluesplash
Reviews.Content: Its not that the La Quinta in a necessarily bad, but it's not that good either. We found the room ok and the service was at a minimum for L.A. Not what we expected and for the same price you can stay somewhere a lot better. If you are looking for somewhere close to the airport for one night, La Quinta is in a good location. But for any longer, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for airport layover, excellent value with extras.”
Reviews.Author: The_organizer
Reviews.Content: I've rated this motel five stars based on two stays which exceeded my expectations for service, amenities, and value of a motel of it's class. If I were consumer reports, I'd rate this a "best buy" My family and I stayed one night in December and another in January on layover to and from Mexico. The location was very convenient. It's close to the airport (located next door to the Holiday Inn Express) and we found the free airport shuttle service easy and reliable. The hotel is on the main strip of airport hotels (Century Blvd) which is a 6 or 8 lane main drag which can be congested at some times of the day. We had no problem at all in the evening, early morning or over the weekend getting to and from the airport in about 10 minutes. Also, regarding the location, there were some late night fast food options available within walking distance which included Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, and McDonalds. There was a subway across the street, but it was a very challenging and big street to cross, so I did not consider it. The hotel also offered some room service options. I walked to Taco Bell one night (little less than a block away) at about 11 p.m. The streets were pretty deserted and I noticed the hotel security watched me leave and waited and watched for my safe return. I found this comforting and thanked him. The hotel is not luxurious, but was EXTREMELY nice for the $72 rate we paid.
