(I booked on the LaQuinta website - checking often for price reductions as the rates did go down a couple of times and it was easy to cancel and rebook at the lower rate) In fact, the hotel would have been acceptable at $125 - $150. The rooms were recently remodeled, very modern with all standard amenities and very clean. The bathrooms were huge. We found the double rooms very accommodating for our family of four. I have attached photos for your review. Some of the extra values that I found impressive were the FREE wireless internet, FREE breakfast, Free airport shuttle (mentioned above), secure luggage check room and the Manhattan Beach trolley ($3 RT-tickets sold at hotel lobby desk) which stopped right in front of the hotel. I was able to access the hotel wi-fi easily with both my laptop and my iPhone. It also proved to be a fast connection. The breakfast was far more than continental. It offered fresh made waffles, yogurt with optional granola topping, 3 cold cereal choices, oatmeal, bagels with assorted optional toppings, muffins, apple and orange juice, coffee and tea. That's what I recall off the top of my head, but it seems there were even more selections. The Manhattan Beach trolley presented an awesome opportunity to kill a few hours during our layover. It makes several stops including the beach (where there is also an aquarium), stolling/shopping areas with boutique type stores and small cafes/restaurant and a stop at a beautiful large mall (where you will find an Apple Store, Bath & Body Works, Victoria Secrets and many other upscale mall stores of this type). The secure luggage check area is a room secured by a security guard (no one else has access) and we were able to check out early, spend the day at Manhattan Beach, retrieve our luggage by 4 p.m., take the airport shuttle and catch our 5:30 p.m. flight. Best of all, I found the staff at this hotel to be very friendly and willing to assist. From the desk clerks to the breakfast team, everyone was extremely nice and helpful. One last thing I forgot to mention is that the hotel has a pool. It is located above street level on the 3rd or 4th floor (I think). It was a nice size and looked inviting. I believe it is a heated pool, but check with the hotel as we did not use it during our stay. I would recommend the La Quinta LAX to anyone looking for a quick and easy airport hotel during a layover. I'd also say that it would be a suitable and affordable option for longer stays that needed to be in this particular area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, but their shuttle is unreliable”
Reviews.Author: OD
Reviews.Content: Many long flights to Hawaii and Australia from the East of North America are routed with a stop in LAX. If you are planning to do this, I hope our experience will be a help. Our journey in January from Toronto to Hawaii had a stop-over in LAX. After being notified of a couple of changes of flights and times by Quantas (because the airlines are saving money they cancel flights and reschedule passengers at will!), it turned out we had a stop-over of 11 hours in LAX, before our morning flight to Honolulu. Rather than waiting in the airport, we decided to take a room and get a few hours shut-eye at the La Quinta. After arrival at LAX airport at 9:30 p.m. the baggage handlers were slow producing our bags . Then we had a long wait for the hotel shuttle outside the airport, and finally gave up on that. It was very confusing as to where people were supposed to wait for hotel shuttles anyway, and there was sign or no airport staff to assist. Occasionally other hotel shuttles just zoomed past and went on out of the airport without stopping it seemed. After 1/2 hour of watching, walking back and forth on the sidewalk trying to get any information, and no shuttle for La Quinta had even been seen however briefly, we gave up on that! We finally stood in a long lineup to get a taxi, and very few taxis appeared. When a taxi appeared, it often didn't take people from the start of the line. People would run out into the street and grab the door handle as the taxi slowed, and thus commandeer the taxi. Finally we got into a taxi when almost everyone else was gone. All in all we didn't get to the hotel until about midnight. The hotel is only about 10 minutes from the airport. We had about 6 hours in bed, and so were reasonably rested. The room was quiet and although close to the airport we were not bothered with airplane noise at all. We were back downstairs at 6:30 with our bags. The included breakfast looked good with fresh fruit and waffles, although we just grabbed a coffee and bun, and stood waiting for the hotel shuttle to take us back to the airport. We had to be there at least by 7:30 a.m. for an 8:30 flight. Finally a group of us, all waiting at the hotel entrance for the shuttle, began to plan to order cabs because the hotel shuttle, which is supposed to be every 15-20 minutes, was just not appearing! Two couples had the presence to mind to order a cab the night before, and they had left. Just as we were all trying to get the desk clerk to order cabs, at about 7:15 or slightly after, the shuttle appeared. The woman driver just said that she was held up in traffic. The net result was our panic on arrival at LAX and we almost didn't make our flight to Honolulu. I have already posted a note on the Los Angeles forum about the lineups at LAX, so I won't repeat it here. The bottom line: don't depend on the hotel shuttle, and see if you can make other arrangements to get back and forth to the hotel. Also be aware that people in Los Angeles are very rude, and you will have to be aggressive to get a taxi at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jedivader
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location (near rental cars, LAX and freeways). Not much too do within walknig distance though. McDonald's and Taco Bell next door. La Quinta does have a bar with bottled beer but if you are looking for a draft, Holiday Inn is right behind it and they have a bar with multiple taps. Service was good and breakfast was typical free hotel type food. The room was nice and clean, the shower did not have much pressure though. The hotel does offer a free shuttle to and from LAX and also a free trolley that will take you down to Manhattan Beach. There is parking, but you will pay $12 a day. One minus to this location is at night, there are many homeless/beggers walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large clean rooms, staff need better manners though”
Reviews.Author: jhoppy01
Reviews.Content: For our last night in the USA, we stayed here as we wante to be close to the airport and we liked LA Quinta in Orlando so much. Rooms were MUCH cleaner than they were in Orlando BUT the staff was quite rude and unhelpful, unlike Orlando where they were lovely. NEar to the airport, free shuttle to the airport and free yummy breakfast (more bagels.......I vow not to touch a bagel again!). Free internet in the lobby which was great for us travellers who didnt take a laptop (didnt matter on the last day though!) Close to some fast food places BUT also in a dodgy part of town so we didnt want to walk far to get dinner. Saw a lot of homeless around that the hotel had security for (all one bloke wanted was the leftovers from breakfast which he poltiely asked for BUT they shoved him out. They were kinder in Orlando) Good for a few days/overnight BUT no good if you want a happy friendly experience

Reviews.Title: “Good value near airport”
Reviews.Author: shellfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at two other hotels near LAX before landing on this hotel. The others were either really dumpy (Holiday Inn Express) or overpriced for little value (Radisson). This hotel was about $80 less than the Radisson, but a better experience. The room was small, but provided everything I needed. It was newly decorated and clean. There's a breakfast included (although I had to leave for the airport too early) and there's a small lobby bar. The only drawback is that there aren't any restaurants nearby except McDonald's and Subway (although you can get some food in the lobby bar). Fortunately, I've always eaten elsewhere before getting there. A co-worker stayed at the same hotel, but had a room on the street side and didn't like the street noise. So I recommend requesting a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelTX
Reviews.Content: This is a newly built hotel that is very close to the airport as well as any highway you will need to take to your destination. Very friendly service, clean and spacious rooms. We booked a King Suite; however, it was much smaller than we expected. The sofas make out into twin beds rather than full. However, the front desk was very nice about booking us two rooms across from each other. After driving all night we arrived around 9:00 in the morning. They were able to put us into a room immediately and offered us breakfast from the breakfast bar. I would highly recommend the facility to anyone traveling in the LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Reception Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sugarcream
Reviews.Content: We booked for 2 double twin rooms, but the reception staff said there were no double twin room left. We then given two Queen bedrooms with fold away beds, which were no way fitting in such small rooms. We make a complained, but this staff didn't not bordered at all, her attitude was really bad!! We been treated with this attitude ever since we checking in. At the end the manager involed and arraged 2 double twin rooms. We didn't understand why she said there were no rooms at the first place, and suddenly there WERE rooms!??!?!!!! Since we been treated with such an impolite staff, we decided to check out earlier (originally we planed to stay for 3 nights). We ended up staying at the Hiton Hotel next door, aparently they offered excetly the same price and much better services!!! We will never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room -Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Virginia_traveler21
Reviews.Content: Perfect for one night prior to departure from LAX. Pleasant staff. Very nice, comfy room. Large bathroom. Free wireless. Close to Airport, and many gas stations (for filling rental car prior to return). Several fast-food options close by. We were traveling with a preschooler and an infant. We liked that they had a proper crib for the infant, and not a pack n' play. Only minor complaint is the teeny-tiny elevator in the parking garage. Total with tax and parking was $103 - seemed a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Usual La Quinta Standard (Great)”
Reviews.Author: rosedrr
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here as we always try to stay at a La Quinta Inn and Suites before a cruise. We typically stay at a La Quinta because they are mostly all the same and you know exactly what to expect. The curved shower curtain rod, pillow top matress, high thread count sheets, free breakfast, great customer service. This is not however your typical La Quinta. It is within a few minutes of LAX and in a downtownish setting. As with most hotels in Los Angeles, the rooms are not as large or roomy as you would find in other cities. But even with the smaller rooms, they were still very comfortable and very clean. They did not have the separate desk/office sitting area as most of them do, they had a table that was setup as a desk with the TV on the right side of it. Overall we were very happy with this La Quinta, just know going in that they are a little smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night only”
Reviews.Author: curatokid
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night in December, arrived to be met by a not very happy reception, the entrance has no "welcome to " signs and in a not very good area, the room was OK for one night, breakfast is from 6am to 9am although when we arrived at 6.10 we were told that breakfast started at 6.00 !!!!!!!!!!! not very happy we had to leave along with other not very happy guests as we had an early flight , I do not understand how this hotel has such a high Tripadvisor rating, I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: jennyb001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to LAX and to the drop off for our rental car at a bargain price. They also provide on site undercover parking while we checked in and unloaded which was important as the road is so busy.The staff were super helpful..offered the front desk computer to print boarding passes when I couldn't hook up to the free wireless...then helped me sort that. The restaurant on-site had good food at a good price which was a great alternative to the fast foods close by. The room was well appointed and spacious and had all we needed and more

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you got a car or you need to stay close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: firestart80
Reviews.Content: I've been here in august 2008 and i was amazed by the hotel, compared to the very low price. It's perfect if you have your car,or you need to stay close to the airport, also because it has an huge, not free, parking, that was, i think, 10 $ / day I booked a twin, but i got a 2 queen sized beds room, very big, and with a nice bathroom too. all the facilities were provided, except from internet, that was not wireless but with ethernet cable, that i had not with me. In room there was a nice sofa too Overall it was very nice and quiet, and very clean too. One of the best hotels of my USA holiday. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “An ideal airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: wakey47
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal airport hotel for those using LAX airport and nothing else. It is miles away from the Hollywood glitz and not ideal for the beaches surrounding Los Angeles. We arrived in L A from London at 2.50 pm picked up our rental car and had booked into the hotel at 4 p.m. it is that close. The room was spacious and it was nice to have a comfy clean queen bed to flop into for a couple of hours before finding something to eat. The decor of the room was o k and the carpet had a dye stain on it but that did not bother us. The hotel has a restaurant that offers a limited dinner menu and a bar. It does offer a complementary buffet breakfast to guests. Guest can also have use of the hotel car park at a fee of $12 per day. The staff were not the happiest bunch of people that I have come across but they did their jobs efficiently and the service within the hotel was good. This area of Central Blvd. is limited for restaurants for those not wishing to use actual hotel facilities. There are a couple of fast food chain drive throughs and a number of larger hotel chains close by offering food. We elected for the internet cafe across the road from the hotel which offered cheap hot food which sufficed our needs but nothing special. To summerise, this is a hotel that is convenient for the airport and is recommended for that purpose only just for one night and no more.

Reviews.Title: “modern , close and convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: ackart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to get an early flight out. The rooms were comfy and modern. The pool was on the 5th floor no hot tub. The shuttle ran quickly. The parking was a charge. If you can return it to the rental car place I would do it . They give you a 30 min courtsey free parking. There is a subway across the street . No business interenet, it was broken they said. Not many places to eat for dinner. I would bring something back with you. The area isnot the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for one night”
Reviews.Author: alexr0
Reviews.Content: The family (a couple and the kid of 11) stayed in the hotel for one night after 22 hours connection flight. Room is large and clean. Breakfast is provided in this hotel and was found good. Price for the room looks inexpensive and the reason is that La Quinta is several hundred meters more far from the airport than others (Radisson, Crown Plaza, etc). However, it is not far from LAX; shuttle to airport comes regularly. We arrived with the car (rented in the airport). I was prepared (thanks to tripadvisor.com) that there is additional $12 fee for parking. The parking lot looks good, entrance to hotel's lobby is quite convenient for visitors with the baggage. I asked for quiet room, was refused since "two beds" quiet rooms were occupied and (listen!) found that in the provided "not quiet" room airport's noise is not heard, absolutely! What can be heard is a little bit of street noise, which is not a disturbance after long connection. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay. The alternative is more expensive hotel, which is closer to airport's runways.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Night's Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: swayvon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on October 24th after flying in from Jamaica. Check-in was prompt. My room was very comfortable and quiet. Loved the bathroom shower. Hotel Shuttle runs every 15 minutes. It's about 10 minutes to LAX. The hotel staff were very helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A satisfactory hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed near LAX for 1 night with my partner, on our extended trip around Europe & the USA, before returning home to New Zealand. We wanted to be close to LAX for our flight the next day, & La Quinta seemed to fit the bill for a reasonable price. We booked our accommodation directly via the hotel website, & confirmed a place to stay for the night. On our arrival (via rental car), we discovered that car-parking is provided, but at a fee of $12/night for guests, & $15 for visitors, which we both considered quite expensive. We checked in easily & found our room to be in excellent order, which included a king-sized bed, desk, small couch/seat, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, TV (with Sky), & private bathroom, with a shower over the bath that had good pressure & plenty of hot water. Our room also had air-conditioning, although it was quite noisy. Wi-fi is provided for free, which is helpful. There is a large pool (no spa) & a fitness room, although the fitness room consisted of 4 training machines & that was it – there was no air-conditioning in the room & it smelled bad! Breakfast is provided in the mornings, although we did not try this. There is a hotel bar, although it looked to be fairly expensive, so we bought some alcohol at a liquor store located about 2 blocks away. The area also has several fast food outlets (McDonalds, Subway, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, etc), some small general grocery stores, & a couple of restaurants. We decided to eat out for dinner, & discovered downstairs on our departure, & again on our return, a line of people out the door waiting to check in (at least 20 or 30 groups of people). We had no idea why the line would be so massive, but could imagine that we would have had a negative opinion of this hotel immediately, had we needed to wait an hour in the queue, just to check in – it was pretty bad, & I felt sorry for all the guests. This property had several large lifts, so it would be suitable for older people, & also suitable for large groups. The airport is very close by. All in all, if you are after a standard airport hotel that is clean & comfortable, then this is the hotel for you. It’s close enough to the airport, & it’s not too expensive. However, the speed of service may be alet down, depending on the time you arrive. If we ever need accommodation near LAX again then we would probably return here. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great One Night Stay!”
Reviews.Author: japfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before flying out of LAX. Great staff, decent breakfast, and quiet room. We were right next to the elevator, but you could hardly hear anything. I wouldn't want to stay here more than a night, but for a good sleep before we flew out early the next day - it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel airport”
Reviews.Author: Shautay
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here one night after arriving in LAX, before moving onto Redondo Beach, our flight got in late and needed a clean place to sleep and refuel before going to our final destination. The hotel staff was very accommodating. When i called down and asked for a cot, they quickly brought one up and we were not charged anything for it. The internet was suprisingly fast, they must have a router on each floor. The continental breakfast was by far the BEST part of this hotel. It was by far the best I've ever had. The pool was difficult to find, the only indication of where it is, is in the elevator, on the fourth floor button it says pool, when you get off at the 4th floor, it gives you no help as where to go next, after wandering a bit, we went back down to the front desk and asked. The pool was adequate, nothing special. The decor was 70s. It did nothing for me at all. But it wouldn't stop me from staying there again. We stayed on the 9th floor and couldn't hear the traffic or the airplanes. We asked for a later checkout and they gave us a 2pm check out with no hassles whatsoever. The shuttle makes it easy to get to and from this hotel. Although it is a busy hotel because it is an airport hotel It would also be a great base point for visiting LA, considering the price, we paid $99 for the night. There is a subway across the street, a Taco Bell and Pizza Hut next door, and a McDonald's less then a block in the other direction. All in all, I'm very happy with our stay here, especially for the price, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with good prices!”
Reviews.Author: sweety2707
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right at the airport, so when people have to catch an early flight or arrive very late it is perfect to stay there. we had no problems at all to get there. a very good hotel with huge rooms and a beautiful swimming pool terrace and a very good breakfast. the hotel also has a parking lot (12$ the night) and is close to eating places (taco bell, mcdonals...)too bad we didn't have our notebook with us because the hotel has wifi for free.everything was perfect and we had a very comfortable and wonderful stay there. there is absolutely nothing to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for going to LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before a flight out of LAX -- its a great spot for a one night stay -- they have comfy rooms and its one of the closest hotels to LAX airport. The bad part is, LAX and that area is so noisy that even on the 10th floor, it was really hard to get any sleep. I overall did not get a good night's sleep and that could have been part of it. Anyhow, as for the property, you can tell it is an older style hotel that has recently been redone - they did a nice job with it and the rooms are very nicely appointed for a La Quinta. The breakfast buffet is fabulous - ready made waffles, granola, a good cereal selections, fruit, muffins, and bagels. I was very satisfied especially since most airlines won't feed you on even long flights these days. I would stay here again, but maybe try asking for a room that doesn't face Century Blvd. Maybe then it would be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a night”
Reviews.Author: angwri
Reviews.Content: The shuttle to & from the airport runs very regularly. This hotel does seem more reasonably priced than others serving LAX. The rooms include TV, clock/radio, iron/board, hairdryer, coffeemaker & a sofa/footstool. One slight aggravation is that there were enough coffee for four mugs, but only enough sugar/creamer for one mug. The area is not great with mainly offices/parking associated with the airport & lots of fast food outlets-Macdonalds, Denny's, Taco Bell, etc. I understand that there is a shuttle bus to the beach & a shopping centre but I found no sign of it during my visit. The hotel does serve bar meals & snacks. I did not eat there, but the prices seemed OK. The complmenatary breakfast is adequate, but they stop serving at 9.00. I would have thought it better to serve it later & allow guests to have a lie in before flights. There is a pool on the fourth floor where you can swim or just chill.

Reviews.Title: “Pragmatic stay”
Reviews.Author: Spanoggel
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel close to the airport. This hotel is one of the cheapest. Like all of them It is easy to reach because of the shuttle bus that leaves at the airport. I personally didn't like the breakfast much but I still think this hotel is good for a one night stay. The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night only”
Reviews.Author: marcian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after the flight from Sydney and then flight to East coast. Old hotel, worn out carpets, bathrooms are very small. 2 double beds rooms are on the street side ( we were on last 10th floor and still noise was coming from the traffic, king size bed on another side into courtyard). Security guard in the lobby gets you feeling that this is not a safe area. This was also the worst breakfast from all the hotels I did travel in USA, orange juice tasted like water, no microwave oven. Forget about MC next door homeless people only take out do not eat in. Danny's is 7-8 minutes walk also food is terrible. The only bright spot is The Internet caffe across the street, good food - but please cross the street on light only. We were OK for one night, but there is no way I would stay here for a extended vacation time or with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, good value, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiggerBoston
Reviews.Content: We asked for a quiet room and we got what we wanted. This hotel has been renovated and the rooms look super. I was pleased that the location was fine (yes it's very close the airport) and not sketchy and the quality was above what I expected. This is a gem for an airport hotel. We stayed here for 4 nights with 2 cats and it all went smoothly. The renovations make the place look like it's worth more than the price. Breakfast was pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great service”
Reviews.Author: thenumbersarebad
Reviews.Content: We were due to arrive at LAX from Honolulu at 11pm, so wanted somewhere near the airport, and La Quinta was the cheapest once we ruled out the ones with really bad reviews. Thanks to American Airlines we arrived 7 hours late, but decided even a few hours sleep was better than nothing. It was 7am by the time we got to the hotel, and their computer was confused by someone arriving the day they were supposed to check out. The clerk went for assistance, and the manager first told him to just give us our keys and sort out the check-in later ("these poor people must be really tired") and then offered us a 2pm rather than noon checkout. This is the kind of customer sevice it's easy to do, but is all too rarely done, in my experience. It's made us dedicated fans of la Quinta. We had breakfast before going to bed - uninspiring but hey, it's free - and managed to get some very welcome sleep. We wished we'd had more time there - the room was big and modern, with a good bathroom, and all in all it was great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick layover.”
Reviews.Author: vktang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an overnight layover in LA, and we decided to stay at the La Quinta by the airport. The hotel is conveniently located in the strip of airport hotels, about 10 minutes away from the airport. The hotel provides free shuttle service to and from the airport (they share the shuttle with two other hotels, and after 1am, it switches to an all-airport hotel shuttle), so if you just have a quick layover, you don't have to worry about renting a car. The room was adequate, clean and quiet, which was just what we needed after a long flight. The staff was friendly and helpful, even at 3am. They provided us with toothbrushes and toothpaste and were chatty. The breakfast was sufficient, although the garbage cans were not cleared out quickly enough and the styrofoam plates and cups started piling up very quickly. All in all, the La Quinta was just what we needed. It was cheap and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rolipop
Reviews.Content: We needed to be close to the airport for an early flight. Here are the plusses: - Very close to LAX, so no traffic before your flight. - Very cute decorating. - Spacious room for the price. - Free breakfast. Here are the downers: - Far from any touristic activity. - No insonorisation at all, we were awaken by a family who arrived in the middle of the night and then by a TV in the next room. You can hear EVERYTHING. - No business center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Navalgus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel just after our arrival at LAX and just before we left. We had great service at front desk and the room were clean and wide. Well located near LAX and all major rental car dealer. Just beside the hotel there's a McDo and a Pizza hunt/Taco Bell, The continental breakfast is, like all other Quinta Inn, very elaborated. We recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “extremely quiet room”
Reviews.Author: actempe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a one-night layover at LAX, based on online reviews. The room was one of the quietest I've ever stayed in, which is exactly what I needed. Staff was friendly, decor pleasing. My only complaint is that they use styrofoam cups instead of water glasses and coffee cups. Unfortunately I had to leave before the complimentary breakfast opened (at 6am). So did a lot of other guests--an earlier start time would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Start”
Reviews.Author: eneri1
Reviews.Content: Came in late Friday nite and needed to get rental car from Thrifty and get some sleep. Thrifty picked us up within 5 minutes of standing at the pickup shuttle area. After getting the car, we only had to drive 1 block (if that) to arrive at the LaQuinta on W. Century Blvd. Hotel was clean/nice. Got it for 79 a nite which included breakfast. Parking was 10 but it was cheaper to get the rental the night before and pay the 10 to park it. This was a great easy start to our vacation. Beds were comfortable too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: acsfoguy
Reviews.Content: My flight arrived into LAX late causing me to miss the last flight out to SFO. I called the La Quinta and got a good price for a room. I was pleasantly surprised at everything I encountered. The professionalism of the staff, the quick & free shuttle service and the modern immaculate room were all above par. I have read other reviews about the breakfast, stating there was eggs and meat There was none of that when I was there. The breakfast consisted of waffles, toast, bagels, cereals, milk, juice, coffee and tea. Nothing special, but enough to get you going before heading off to LAX. I would definitely stay there again, and recommend it to friends as an excellent inexpensive layover at LAX

Reviews.Title: “Still OK”
Reviews.Author: kalayka
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but cleanliness can make-up for this. I guess recession has affected the free breakfast. There are less choices from two months ago. The meat items were conspicuously absent. Overall I still find this hotel OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel with Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: dodgergirl
Reviews.Content: Rented a one bedroom suite... The bedroom was decent size. Clean room and bathrooms. Large livingroom with flat screen TV. The loveseat made into a bed.. Thought it was sorta funny though . The bed was very small. Just for one person. Smaller than a twin bed. They should have a full size sofa sleeper I think..The suite had 2 bathrooms. These was great for getting ready for an early morning flight. The check in was easy and fast. We left our vehicle parked in their covered parking during our trip. The charge was $15.00 per day. During your stay they charge you, I believe $12.00 per day. We left really early in the morning so we didn't eat their free breakfast. The shuttle was very fast. It is partnered with a couple other hotels. La Quinta is the last pick up, so that is good for getting to the airport fast. The driver was very helpful with luggage. When we returned from our trip just went to the hotel shuttle spot and we were picked up and dropped off at the La Quinta again. We did arrive around 11:00 P.M., so there was no parking attandant to pay. We had to pay at the front desk. That was alittle bit of a pain as there were alot of people checking in, which made the wait sorta long. I just wanted to get the car and get home. Overall we will stay again when we have an early morning flight. Great location by the airport.. PS.. I thought it was quiet too

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: sc121980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days during a recent vacation in LA. For the price we paid through Priceline, I don't feel like my friend and I received a bad deal at all. The room was ready for us when we checked in around 3 or 4pm and everything in the room was clean. The room was a bit small and not particularly well-stocked but again, based on the price, it wasn't anything we couldn't overlook. Pros: Close to several fast food restaurants, which is nice when it is late and you are looking for cheap eats. Decent breakfast buffet from 6am to 9am each morning. Close to the 405 highway and to many of the rental car offices, gas stations and LAX. Rooms have a hair dryer, microwave and refrigerator. There is a gift shop on the property that sells snacks, drinks, medications, magazines, etc. Cons: The parking situation is a pain. It is $12 a day for guests but in order to get into and out of the lot, you have to use pain in the neck parking stubs. And there is a prominent sign that warns if you lose your parking stub, you are facing a $200+ fine. To me, that seems rather harsh and we had to spend our time in LA paranoid that we had possession of the parking stub all at times. To leave, you must stop at the desk and have the clerk validate your parking. When there is a long line, this is particularly maddening. One afternoon, we had to wait 30 minutes behind a huge church group of people who were checking into the hotel one at a time. One clerk was working with these people while the other clerk was talking on the phone. All this waiting to simply have a parking stub validated seemed rather needless. There were times at night when noise became a major factor. Surprisingly, there wasn't much noise coming from the airplanes but there seemed to be quite a few guests making noise at all hours. A party of drunks knocked on our door at 2am each night that we were there and one night, we had to roll towels under the door to block out the smell of cigarette smoke and burnt food. These elements are not the fault of the hotel, but are things you should be aware of if you stay there. Bringing earplugs may not be a bad idea if you need a good night's sleep. All things considered, if you are able to negotiate a good price to stay here and are seeing LA on a tight budget (as we were), this is a good place to add to your hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: barbann78
Reviews.Content: My husband's family and I stayed at this hotel for two nights this past weekend. The hotel decor is relatively modern and all three rooms occupied by us were clean and comfortable (parents had a suite, two children had double/king bed rooms). The suite which was on the airport side of the hotel had a great view of planes landing and taking off and was not at all noisy. However, the other two rooms overlooked the street, and even from the ninth floor, the street noise could be heard. The hotel staff was friendly though not necessarily helpful. They refused to honor the price they quoted me by phone when I made the reservation several months earlier, and it took two requests (several hours apart) before I finally could have a crib delivered to our room for my infant daughter (crib was not one I would ever use of my own choosing either!). They also charged my in-laws $4 for a phone call to a pizza place right down the road (though they ultimately removed it). The breakfast buffet was sub-par. Not even an extensive selection of fresh pastries was offered as at most budget hotels! In fact, we ended up going to McDonald's the second morning. We have stayed the Hampton Inn right down the road on several prior visits so we obviously had that as our frame of reference when staying here. It just didn't match up! We may be willing to splurge the extra few bucks next time and head back to the Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GirlieGirlTravel
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night at the La Quinta LAX after arriving from Tampa. For just one night and at a price of $115 it was just right. Yes, there was some street noise but for a night's stay it's a good choice. The airport shuttle runs constantly with fairly quick service directly to the hotel's door. We had a late arriving flight (midnight) but the van operator was friendly and efficient. The front desk acted as if they were waiting just for us and smiled through the entire rapid check-in process. I had forgotten my toothbrush and was instantly given one. Then we asked for conditioner and creamer was delivered but I think that was just a language mix-up :) There was a complimentay breakfast in the morning which was pretty extensive. We needed to go back to the airport to pick up our rental car but the van driver was surprisingly helpful by just bringing us directly to the Budget rental office instead of us having to shuttle again from the airport. That was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great bed”
Reviews.Author: Neil_in_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. There was a continental breakfast (eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, etc). The bed was great - padded pillow top that just absorbed me into the bed. Extensive cable selection even though it was Lodgenet. My room was facing away from Century Blvd and so it was very quiet - little to no plane noise. If you rent a car from Thrifty or Payless or Fox, the rental locations are just about right across the street. Less than 5 minutes walk to each of them. There was a McDonalds and a Taco Bell next door to the hotel; the Arco gas station next to McDonalds had the cheapest gas in the neighbourhood (15 cents/gallon less than the Chevron across the street). If you want to avoid paying for parking, you can park for free directly across Century Blvd in front of the Subway/Office building - usually easily available at night, but you'll have to move your car by 9 am (1 hour parking afterwards). Shuttle service runs about every 10-15 minutes, in a large blue shuttle bus shared with the Westin and Holiday Inn next door. Great hotel for the price - especially since I won it on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: funtravelfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Spring break trip to LA. We were picked up by the shuttle quickly at the airport. The rooms were nice and clean. Bathrooms a little small, but nothing to complain about. The breakfast was wonderful and well stocked. A good drive into Hollywood, but we rented a car and it was not too bad. Can't comment on the pool as it was too cool to use it. Would stay here again if we were in LA. We give this hotel a thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “can't be beat....”
Reviews.Author: marathonmoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta for one night since we had an early flight out of LAX. It was wonderful. The room was very nice, Ikea modern and the staff was pleasant. We didn't get to stay for breakfast, but the airport shuttle was on time and very quick. All and all, a very pleasant experience for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: dillybarPa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for an overnight stay. Rooms were clean but a little cramped. Marcel the bartender is the best!! Make sure you go see him. The free breakfast was okay but did not have any meats or fresh fruit. I would stay here again if I have an early flight out of LAX again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overnight Choice”
Reviews.Author: davedmd
Reviews.Content: This ones a winner for a short stay. We had to spend one night in LA by the airport to catch a plane next day. The Hotel is a great location with airport shuttle service every 15 minutes. The room was completly renovated, clean, quiet and comfortable. Great deal for the price, can't tell you about the breakfast as we had to live very early next day. Streets were safe to walk, but the best part is theres a free shuttle service which takes you from the hotel to Manhattan Beach shops and retaurants. You can hop on the bus and in about 20 minutes be dining or clubbing in some nice restaurants instead of the dreary airport dives. The other disspointment here was there lobby computer was down and we couldnt print our airline tickets, so we went across the street to the hyatt or something.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: memajajo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after and before flights into and out of LAX on two different nights. The airport shuttle runs every 15 minutes and is reliable. The hotel is clean, Front desk personnel are a little slow but they are helpful and friendly. We had king-bed rooms and they were roomy and clean. The beds were comfortable. The shower in one of the rooms had very little water pressure but the second one was great. We had a problem with a vending machine, and the front desk remidied the situation immediately. The breakfast is good - scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, danishes and fruit - all you can eat. All in all we were very satisfied for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: rocketmanHonolulu_HI
Reviews.Content: I spent a week there in February, 2008. It's newly remodeled in Ikea fashion, extremely well done. Clean, fresh, efficient, courteous. The rooms are small, European style, but there's everything a full service hotel has, TV, free wireless internet, all that stuff, plus a full breakfast is included, and the beds are new and comfortable. It's not a resort, so don't expect one. It's simply a real nice room and a place to sleep. There's a rudimentary restaurant; the breakfast restaurant becomes pizza and burgers in the evening, and there's a simple bar. No ambiance, etc., but who cares? There are great restaurants in Marina Del Rey, about ten minutes north, and Manhattan Beach, which is just about as close. If it had a restaurant and room service I would have given it a five star. Ask for a room in the back, which is quieter. It's far enough from the airport that you don't hear aircraft noise. I got the airline employee rate of $79 for 3 nights, then $99 after that. (Should have checked out and checked back in again, but what the hey.) Parking is $10.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kimura-sensei
Reviews.Content: Best bang for the buck. $45 on priceline, came out to roughly $55/night after tax. This isn't your typical La Quinta, the hotel has been completely remodeled. As others have mentioned, it looks like you walked into an IKEA catalog. Most important part, the hotel and the rooms are very clean that I can walk barefoot. Breakfast: Scrambled eggs, may have sausage (offered on Monday, wasn't there fri/sat/sun), fried potatoes, bagels, toast, cold cereal, OJ, AJ, milk, coffee, apples, oranges, bananas, yogurt. It's free, and pretty much the same like any other 2 or 3 star hotel. As for food. There is a Mickey D's next door. Subway sandwich shop open 24hrs across the blvd. Nothing else around within walking distance. FYI, don't chance going across the blvd for Subway at night, LA drivers are horrible. Too dangerous, you can get hit. Internet access: Wireless in every room, free, although very slow at 30k/sec. Speeds up to 50k/sec when not many guests around or asleep. Business center: Didn't use, they charge for access. It's located across the lobby in the garage section. There is a complimentary PC kiosk in the lobby, but it's like playing with a kid protection software. Basic web mail, boarding pass print outs, and tourist attraction info access only. I tried using it, couldn't access my pass but the folks at the counter were more than happy to assist me and print my boarding pass out. Shuttle: It comes every 20-30 mins. It's shared service between 3 or 4 hotels, so unlike other dedicated hotel shuttles, they won't drive you anywhere else, no nearby restaurants or to the local subway. Noise: I can confirm what others say. This hotel is in the flight pathway and yes, you can hear the planes overhead. I recommend you bring some earplugs or turn on the noisy AC on low -- it's noisy like any other hotel AC.

Reviews.Title: “Another Bowden Review!!! Pretty good the place, the La Quinta.”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: Good place. I got this for $50 on priceline like I always do, because I am highly intelligent. Rooms are generally north of $90. Rooms are clean and modern. It's my understanding that the recently renovated the place. There is a bar downstairs and they serve typical bar food, like burgers and wings. They call it a restuarant, but the menu has like 8 items. Location is good as it's less than a mile to the airport and it's my understanding they had a shuttle, although I had a rent-a-car Parking is $10. Overall its a clean place, good value. Bowden68 gives his thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Value”
Reviews.Author: IaTravel
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasantly surprising hotel. We stayed 2 nights with a 4 month old. The hotel is up to date and modern. The room was good sized, the shower and bath excellent. We had a room that was not facing the street and it was very quiet. The included free breakfast was fantastic, with hot scrambled eggs, waffles, and sausage in addition to regular continental fare. The parking facility was excellent but cost $10 per day extra. The location was good very near the 405 and of course minutes from the airport and car rental returns. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The included wireless internet access was fast and reliable. The only complaint was that the lobby computer, where you can print out your boarding passes, was very slow and the printer did not work. When I asked the front desk about it, they allowed me to use their front desk computer and printer to print our boarding passes. Overall excellent. We got this for $99 per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Rooms Are Nice”
Reviews.Author: planetgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked on Hotwire and paid $79 per night, I think. The rooms are a lot nicer than the lobby. Amenties are new(er) and there is a fridge and microwave. Flatscreen TVs, v. clean rooms. My only complaint is you can't open the windows. The lobby was freezing at breakfast, but the breakfasts provide a lot of food and you can go back as often as you like. They should also add more seating because this was an issue. The hotel is v. convenient to the freeway and 3 mins from the airport. The shuttle was fine. They refunded my calls because it was not explained to me that there is a charge to use your calling card. I didn't have to pay the $10 parking fee, either, because of this misinformation. I spoke up about it and so they conceded, which I thought was nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Sgoes
Reviews.Content: We just needed a place to spend the night before an early morning flight home from visiting our son. This was a great deal for only $89. The newly renovated rooms are clean and bright. The breakfast was more than adequate. The shuttle ran on time and everyone was very helpful. I wouldn't book this if I wanted to tour LA but it was a steal for just a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lax Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilboman2001
Reviews.Content: stayed here with a 49 bid on priceline for 2.5* the rooms are newly renovated (abiet cheaply, its like straight out of an ikea catalog) and was clean and the beds quite comfortable. they include internet and full breakfast (as in meats and eggs as well) in the morning so the property provides good value. as stated, the room was clean and newly renovated, nothing fancy at all, but great for for a stay before/after a flight or if you want to be close to santa monica but at a decent rate. only concern was the elevators are slow (seems they only operated 1-2 of the available 3 elevators) and check in/out can be slow since they usually only have one person working the desk. the common areas like the parking and front lobby is also kind of sketchy and i was a bit worried about the property until i reached my room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience for a distressed traveler.”
Reviews.Author: highpod
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in LA after a missed connection (long story, blame Orbitz) and got put up at La Quinta. Was pleasantly surprised to find a nice clean, modernized hotel for a great rate (distressed traveler rate) with wireless, good food & a bar. What else do you need for a non-intentional stay? Only problem is there is really nothing to do or see in the area, especially on foot. Loved the room decor, the comfortable bed and the free wireless throughout. The shuttle was convenient enough and runs 24 hours. Staff was friendly and efficient. TV had quite a few options with a few HBO channels included. Would stay here again if in the LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Every Expectation”
Reviews.Author: TonyDean
Reviews.Content: This was a really pleasant surprise from a La Quinta branded hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located to the airport, but is not your typical airport hotel - nor your typical La Quinta. The decor in the rooms is very "boutique", just incredibly sophisticated. When you walk into the room you might as well be staying at a "W" or another hip property. From sculptured towels in the bathrom, to high tech lighting fixtures, from smart duvet covers to incredibly comfortable beds, it is hard to believe that this is a La Quinta. Really, the rooms are that nice... and spotlessly clean! Even the lobby suprises in its decor, presenting a mix of sophisticated California with a hip, New York edge. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, though not overly knowledgable about the area. We asked them where to eat and they clearly had no idea outside of the hotel restaurant. However, here is something that will amaze you. I was in LA calling on a client with corporate offices located nearly 20 miles away. Even our client knew about what a value this hotel offers. Our client actually said that the hotel restaurant was one of the best near the airport. I hardly ever eat at hotel restaurants, and didn't during this stay, so I can't say if their claims proved to be true. But isn't it surpising that a major buyer with one of North America's largest retailers would actually know about this hotel? Much less the restaurant? The LaQuinta LAX must enjoy an excellent reputation with the locals. Two suggestions... (1) All of the lighting fixtures in the room are in brushed steel, however the handles on the closet, main and bathroom doors are in tacky brass. They actually detract from the unbelievable presentation in the decor and would be easy to change out. (2) The television, which you aren't really going to watch anyway, is an old fashioned CRT model. This hotel cries out for an LCD wall mount television. The bathroom vanity is stunning. The artwork tasteful and sophisticated. Everything else about the room is fantastic. I have spent hundreds of dollars a night all over the world for rooms that aren't as well appointed as this.... just please replace the door hardware and the televisions. If you want a great location, convenient to the airport and interstates, friendly staff, and a room that will exceed your expectations.... book THIS LaQuinta. One final word, the check in girl said it was unsafe to walk anywhere after dark in the neighborhood. We had a car and never sensed any danger... however be cautious if you are on foot and don't receive a similar warning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: daveqwerty
Reviews.Content: We booked La Quinta over the internet (via expedia.ca) for a one-night stop-over in LA. On arrival at LAX, we were quite concerned to find that their phone number had been deliberately removed from their advertisement on the hotel phone-boards. However, on enquiry at the LAX information desk, we found that their shuttle stops regularly and continually at the red sign in the outside booth (too bad they didn't say this on the phone-board). The shuttle comes very quickly and service by the driver was exemplary. He loaded everybody's bags and then, once reaching the various hotels, unloaded the bags, remembering whose bags were whose -- pretty impressive! The shuttle serves about three different hotels which are very closely spaced and the total trip is only about 7 minutes max. The hotel was quite nice. Since we booked one of the cheaper rooms, we did not expect too much but it was very clean. The king-size bed was a bit hard but quite adequate. There was no room-safe which would have been a problem on a longer stay. The sink drain was clogged but on calling reception, a plumber appeared within 2 minutes and, when he couldn't fix it immediately, they very quickly apologized and moved us to a room down the hall. The employees wear a button asking you to tell them if they are not a "10" and I would say they tried very hard and we easily gave them a "10". The people in the restaurant were extremely friendly and bubbling over with enthusiasm and most helpful. Prices were reasonable and we had a great clubhouse sandwich. On the return stop-over, we stayed with them again. Booking via the internet gets a decidedly lower rate but I suspect a lower quality room as well. They must have changed cooks because the clubhouse sandwich this time was a total embarrassment to the facility but I wouldn't hold this against them since it was so great the previous time. We gave then a "10" and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: RobbieMac71
Reviews.Content: This was the first room I ever booked on priceline and was kinda nervous about it. Reviews were mixed but I have no complaints at all. Rooms were spotless and recently renovated in an "Ikea" theme. Hotel was secure, parking was $10, wireless worked, and I only paid $59. At that pricepoint you can do much much worse!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here Twice,”
Reviews.Author: BackHomeCt
Reviews.Content: with in 2 weeks, and had great check-in with Alfonso, who was also nice enough to print our boarding pass for next day morning flight. Our room was very clean, very comfortable, GREAT king bed. Very nice bathrm..all in all, we were so happy we chose La Quinta! (Have stayed in others, but this mattress was by far one of the best in our travels.) We enjoyed a very nice hot complimentary breakfast before our flight, the shuttle arrived on time and took all of 7 min to reach our terminal. We had the same experience on our return trip 10 days later! We returned a rental car to Thriftys, which basically was walking distance to La Quinta, making for a nice easy return & check-in. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering”
Reviews.Author: couver98662
Reviews.Content: As an airline crewmember and frequent hotel guest, my recent stays as this property have been short, but have been comfortable. The rooms have been recently updated (it looks like they went to an IKEA show room) and for the price are competative with other bigger brand names along Century Blvd. Free wireless and Shuttle service between the hotel and the airport. Parking is available as well. The shuttle service is a contracted company that serves a majority of the Century blvd hotels and is lacking in timely service. You should give yourself at least 30 minutes of travel time to go the relatively short distance from the property to the terminal. The bus fills up quickly during peak times, and this is the last pickup prior to the airport, so you may be standing. Dont expect quick service from the front desk, either. checkin times can be lengthly, especially in the evenings. There are several fast food selections near the hotel, however for your personal safety I would avoid walking east of the 405, especially at night. If you what your looking for is a clean economical hotel near LAX, you could do better and certainly do worse. This hotel is worth the consideration for the business traveller who needs consist of a clean room, free internet, and an iron.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, but cheap & clean”
Reviews.Author: AJP-Tokyo
Reviews.Content: low quality, low service airport hotel. OK if you can get a room for $80 or less and for a short stay near LAX. Very slow front desk service, no sense that staff have any organization. Don't expect a fast checkout or much help while you're there. Rooms clean, and amenities what you'd expect for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Maree-Kevin
Reviews.Content: We've just spent a night at the La Quinta Inn & Suites near Los Angeles Airport. Our stay in LA was merely to break the journey back home to Australia, from NYC to Sydney. Not being a fan of LA I was dreading the 24 hours we would be there, however our experience at La Quinta made a huge difference. We arrived at 11.00pm via the free shuttle from LAX and were greeted by cheery staff who actually seemed pleased to see us. As our flight from LA to Sydney was not due to leave until 10.30pm the following night, we requested a late check-out - no problem! La Quinta happily gave us until 2.00pm. We then left our luggage in their care and took advantage of the other free shuttle that runs literally outside the front door from the hotels in the LAX area to Manhattan Beach and Manhattan Beach Mall. This was a great way to fill in some of the 8.5 hours we had to kill between checking out and our flight departing. The room was clean and comfortable; not a fabulous view but then LAX doesn't really afford great views. The room had a lot of space for a budget room, plus a fridge, microwave, coffee-maker and a desk with a proper office chair. The hotel itself has recently been tarted up with new fittings and furniture. The free breakfast was great - everything from cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagels/toast to pastries, eggs, home fries and waffles. Nothing can really make the prospect of a 15-hour flight more appealing but our stay at La Quinta ensured we were well rested. We would definitely stay at La Quinta again - they were really out to please, and they did. - Maree & Kevin, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler54
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently. It's a good hotel, good location and it is consistent. Excellent value using Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel if you have a late or early LAX flight”
Reviews.Author: jmk1
Reviews.Content: Room booked on Priceline. The shuttle came quickly (every 15 min.) The room was clean and QUIET. the bed was comfortable. Free wireless. free breakfast. Would stay again next time I go through LAX.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites LAX
HotelInfo.Address: 5249 West Century Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90045
